Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: I don’t think this is legit.
Review: I LOVE this conditioner, it’s so good for my curly hair and works very well, that said what I received from my amazon subscribe and save order is NOT the conditioner I’ve been using.  This is the second bottle I’ve ordered, I noticed a difference in consistency when I gave my daughter the first bottle, but assumed they maybe changed the formula. I think this is counterfeit now with the second bottle after comparing, which  is disappointing, because a major factor in buying Pacifica products is that they are vegan and cruelty free, and with a counterfeit item you can pretty much guarantee that’s not the case.The left side of each photo is the bottle I just finished off, the right side is what was received from amazon.A) the bottles are very different, the amazon one looks and feels cheaply made, different graphic qualities too. Size is all wrong.B) the scent is not as strong and more vanilla with the amazon product, the product I normally buy has a strong fruity/pineapple scent.C) the consistency is SOOO different. The one I normally buy is thick and creamy, goes a long way. The one from amazon is thin like cheap conditioner.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Harsh conditioner negates the gentle shampoo
Review: (Reviewed as a set.) I love pineapple and wanted to love this product so much, I bought the set.  I have long, thick, curly, indigenous hair that tends to frizz; I'm also sensitive to scents, and lean toward natural products. SHAMPOO: Has a light, sweet, real-fruit smell that wants more depth, more power. It does not smell pina colada-y but I think I do get a whiff of banana (not my favorite). I imagine that scent is hard to balance in hair products; overall I like it. The lather is super thick with a nice, clean silky rinse and leaves my wet hair feeling clean and soft instead of stripped, with truly defined spiral curls. I can't detect any pineapple scent in my hair after rinsing. Feels nice, a good shampoo that is gentle enough to use often. However, I prefer washing 1x/week, so that's a little too gentle for me. But I liked it and was excited to try a conditioner that would amplify and continue that sweet, soft, curly feeling. It disappointed. CONDITIONER: Same scent, no issues. Feels light but strange and slick going on, and is actually too light/thin for thick hair. I had to use a lot of it, more than other conditioners, and had to press it into my hair to absorb-- it felt like a rebellious conditioner that didn't want to perform. It left the exact opposite feeling from the shampoo: greasy residue, not natural, ill-formulated, and drying. It clings to my hair, not in the way you want, so I had to rinse and rinse and rinse, negating the initial good shampoo. Pacifica products are not cheap in price, but are becoming more cheap in feel. My search for curly-hair cleansing products continues....

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is an average conditioner. The best feature is that it smells delicious. It's a thin conditioner and I can barely believe that it's intended for textured hair since it provides almost no moisture. This is best for straight, low porosity hair. It does nothing for my medium porosity, frizz prone wavy-curly hair. Maui Moisture has so many better options for a drug store brand. I also like the Garnier conditioners in the jars. They are silicone free as well!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Curl relaxer not enhancer or definer
Review: I have thick wavy with loose curls hair.  This product flattened my hair and made it feel dirty (felt oily with built up residue)  This may be a good product for people with tight curls that want to relax them.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Great for Curly Hair
Review: In the past couple months I have learned the Curly Girl Method and I have been experimenting with some shampoos and conditioners. I really REALLY like this one a lot. It has a fruity smell that is a bit strong but not so strong to deter me (That is actually what worried me the most because I have a sensitive stomach when it comes to strong smells, and especially the "exotic" pineapple, banana, and such smells really make me keel over in the mornings). Initially, out of the bottle it is a bit strong but after washing it really isn't that strong, the smell of my shampoo is actually stronger. Anyways, sometimes I don't put in argon oil after showering to help keep my curls and I notice that with this conditioner, without the oil, it still helps keeps my curls nice. They are softer and a little looser without the oil or styler but it works great and I have been getting lots of compliments!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Excellent for fine hair - a dupe for wavemaker.
Review: I was really hesitant to try this but I'm so glad I did. I have fine 2b high porosity hair (the kind that gets super frizzy in a little bit of humidity). I've used a tonne of products and this is def one of my all time favourites. It's alot like wavemaker and cantu - and I only use a peasized amount of it. Gives some volume (but doesn't make your hair feel weighed down or full of product). I don't really need to layer products with this but if I really want to, I add a spritz of the b&b invisible oil primer or homemade salt spray!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Surprisingly light and long-lasting
Review: Love this stuff. It smells light and natural. I use a small pea sized amount for my shoulder length hair if I am pulling it back, and about twice that much if I am wearing it down. It defines the curls and keeps the frizzies down. It doesn't coat my hands, washes off easily, and doesn't weigh my hair down with heavy/waxy stuff like some products do. This small tube lasts a long time, too.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Curls POP and BOUNCE
Review: For my whole life I needed two bottles of conditioner per one bottle of shampoo...and that was just for the stuff I wasn't using for co-washing.  For the last 10 years or so I've been using DevaCurl, and I've rarely tried anything else.  I've been using 10-14 pumps of conditoner every day. I really overdid it the first time I tried Pineapple Curls and I was am still stunned that a small palmful coats and detangles all my hair! It's like I can't use a small enough amount!  I was worried that a 10 oz. tube would last me a week, but this conditioner is so concentrated, my daughter and I are both using it and it's lasting for weeks! This is my new favorite conditioner.  This does not weight my hair down in the least - instead it makes my curls spring and bounce.  I have 2c-3b (mostly 3a) low porosity, coarse curls. I wish I'd found this conditioner a long time ago! I am crazy about the smell...like vacation on Maui!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: great product
Review: I have2c-3b curls and fine hair. Works great without weighing down-you dont need much

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Good stuff. Bigger bottle please
Review: Hi I have 3c curly hair and its bleach blonde and I been looking for something to replace my Cantu curl cream activator that I love but it's getting harder to find so I tried this curl defining cream and I really like it. My curls are shiny and  bouncy I do use a gel after nut I like it alot. I will say my only complaint is for 13 bucks I wish the bottle was bigger.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Wave Killer
Review: This conditioner killed my waves completely. I've been using curly girl approved products and building up my waves for about a year now and after one use of this conditioner my hair was straighter than before I started. I tried clarifying my hair and giving it another shot, but got the same results.The consistency of this product does seem strange, as other reviews stated. It's VERY watery, but I've never used it before so it's possible that this is normal and not the result of tampering.All in all, it makes my hair very soft and smooth, but I wouldn't recommend for wavy hair.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: I loved this until..
Review: So I have been having issues with allergies. My old cowash and conditioner started making me break out in hives (yikes) so I switched to a new cowash and this conditioner. I personally love this brand and had never used their hair products.The conditioner, while called pineapple, to me smells just like banana runts. I really loved it. Made my hair soft and made the wave and curl in my hair pop.Unfortunately, I started to have issues where everytime I used it, it made my head itch terribly. When I compared it to the other stuff I had issues with, I found an ingredient that they shared. So when looking for something new, I spent a lot of time to find something without that ingredient.Do highly recommend it though! Wish I could still use it.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Counterfeit or Watered Down...
Review: I love this product but it is definitely not the same product I've used in the past. It is much more watery - not the nice thick cream it normally is. I also noticed there was an ingredient sticker placed over the ingredients on the bottle. I checked the reviews to see if others had noticed anything different and sure enough some had and at least one person also had the sticker over the ingredients. I requested a refund and I am going to buy this one in store from now on. What a bummer because subscribe-and-save is so convenient.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Not even close to the Deva Curl Wavemaker
Review: If I use it with just mousse it does not moisture my hair enough, it actually leaves it quite dry and frizzy. I really wanted to like it because the packaging is so cute and many said the smell was great. To me the scent is nice but not as strong as say Cantu. I am using it mixed with Shea moisture coconut and hibiscus smoothie because that was too moisturizing lol so mixed together they work great. I am still searching for a replacement for the Devs Curl wavaker. This ain't it. For reference, I have thin, low density, medium porosity, 2C-3A hair.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Easy to manage hair & great scent
Review: This smells so good, I used too much the first time, just to inhale the tropical scent. My curls dragged down, so the next time I used less & my curls were bouncier. An unexpected benefit is that my thick hair wets down more easier for shampooing when I use this curl cream. I have thick hair & we have a lot of minerals in our water.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Fantastic product for my curls
Review: When my hairstylist told me that I should go with my natural curls, I tried so many different products but nothing seemed to work right. I am a natural blonde with thick curly short hair. This product is awesome. I wet my hair a little bit with Pacifica hair and body spray or water and then use the cream to crunch in my curls. Looks awesome every time.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Very different products
Review: Shampoo:-Nice light scent, pleasant and not overly sweet-Foamy and cleansing, while still being gentle-Hair feels super soft, even after rinsing-12oz bottle, nice designConditioner:-Same scent, maybe a bit muted-Wayyy to thin, it doesn't truly condition-Ruins the soft feeling from the shampoo-8oz bottle, and much more is needed than the shampoo. It'll run out way before the shampoo with the amount needed for it to somewhat work as conditioner. Even then, I don't think it's worth even using it.Conclusion:I absolutely recommend the shampoo, and I'll continue to use it. The conditioner may wind up in the trash. :(

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Good conditioner
Review: I have been CGM for 18 months. I have read multiple positive reviews about this product so I decided to try it.Now what I have learned in this journey is that your curls are not the same as mine so let me tell you about my curls. I have pretty tight curls. My hair is THIIIRRRRSSSTTTY so it desires moisture and my hair is average (not too thick or too thin)With this description, I’d like to tell you that my hair loved this product. It smells delicious, it works fabulous as a leave in but it is a tad runny so I used a lot. I think I used it 4 times and it’s gone. I’m going to buy it again because it made my hair bouncy, light and it looked moisturized.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Too thin...seems like a watered down return
Review: I've bought this conditioner before and loved it.  I bought it again and now it is very thin and even a bit foamy and it's like I didn't use conditioner at all.  I suspect this was a return that someone added water or something to.  To test that theory, I attempted a return and lo and behold they do allow returns.  I'm just throwing it....obviously Amazon is selling USED toiletries as NEW.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Killed my waves
Review: Naturally my hair does a beach wave. I’ve been working to encourage and develop it. I took a shot on this set, and wish I hadn’t. It made my hair so silky, that it doesn’t hold any texture at all. The pictures are my hair after the first wash with this set vs. it’s natural air dried wave. I don’t know how they market this as a product to help waves and curls. I’m just going to use it on my little girls straight hair and go back to Shea Moisture.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Lightweight
Review: Great product for wavy hair. I layer this with a gel on soaking wet hair and it really helps define and clump. I would say it definitely needs a gel or a mousse because it has little to no hold. Has a faint coconut scent to me I don’t get pineapple at all

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Not greasy, leaves hair feeling soft <3
Review: Easily one of the best products I've ever used (33y). I've spent a lot of my life looking for a product that wouldn't leave my hair hard as wax or greasy. I think I've finally found a product to stick with. I just hope irony doesn't rear its ugly head and then the place goes out of business leaving me searching for another 20 years.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Hydration
Review: It provides a great hydration to my hair. I have 2c/3b hair texture w some loose curls here & there, Since I live in a hot humid area I’m always struggling w frizz & lack of definition. When using this mask I notice my hair seems more juicy & defined, & it smells great. Doesn’t feel heavy but it’s not light either(does that make sense?) but it provides enough moisture. I do find I need to use conditioner to be able to distribute it though out, as soon as it’s on, it feels very rich. works great so far. I would deff recommend to somebody who needs a little hydration boost.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: I'm obsessed...
Review: I accidentally ordered 2 of these instead of 1, but I'm in love with this conditioner so I'm happy for the spare!! It smells so good, like a yummy tropical vacation. I like the ingredients, I like that it doesn't have silicones. The best part of this conditioner is how lightweight it is, yet it actually detangles my hair. I have naturally wavy and very tangly hair and I always comb through it after putting conditioner in. This passes the comb-through test. A lot of other conditioners are just heavy, but don't actually detangle. This one detangles, makes my hair super soft and shiny after rinsing, enhances my natural wavy texture, and smells amazing. I will definitely be ordering more!!!!!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: My hair surprisingly loves this product
Review: I have 3c hair (confused on my exact porosity) and this is the only product I have been happy with after experimenting with other leave ins and oils for about a year. My hair loves moisture and it was difficult to find a leave in that wouldn't dry so quickly. What i really liked about this leave in was that I only needed water to refresh my curls after a while. Usually I have to redo my curls all together (re add random leave in, add water, try not to cry and get frustrated lol)  throughout the day and other products tend to make my hair stiff and dry so I try to find moisture combinations that work. I wasn't afraid to use this everyday and that says a lot.  I also noticed less shedding with this cream. I thought it was because I was taking better care of my hair in general, but when I ran out of Pacifica and started using not so good cheap products, my hair started to shed a lot again. This is the only product I feel like my hair is safe with for now! I literally just ordered my second bottle and the new curl pomade. My hair can't deal with the mess of gels and oils and random leave ins any longer. My only complaints are that I wish the bottle was bigger and the smell lasted longer. I think less is more because I have to make sure I spread the cream throughout my hair and use a little more water and oil combinations and then my hair is nice and soft and surprisingly bouncy. If your hair has a love-hate relationship with protein, then use less and make sure it's spread out evenly! (It contains coconut oil) It's meant to be a lightweight product, I just got carried away because I literally love this product lol. My hair is strange to me. As someone with fine curly wavyish strands but high volume "ethnic" hair, the right amount goes a long way.  I used way more than other reviews said because my hair loves the moisture. I was low-key surprised this worked on my hair type lol. It made my hair routine more enjoyable. Instead of redoing my hair when I want to refresh my curls now all I do is add water and maybe an oil to seal but this cream contains oil and leaves my scalp soft and massageable lol. I'm so wary of products that claim to be vegan and silicone free but this formula is what I needed so far.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Perfect for my dry curls
Review: I have super dry, curly, fine hair. I've basically been searching for balanced products my entire life. I had purchased Pacifica's lilac lotion, and knew their quality, so I took a gamble on the conditioner. Although pineapple is my favorite fruit, I must say this smells a little too sickly sweet for me (like right before a pineapple is about to go). That aside, OH MY GOD, it's the creamiest, non-greasy, buttery conditioner I have ever used! I LOVE how my curls feel and look, and the great news is that the scent mostly disappears after you rinse it out. Once my hair is dry I hardly notice the pineapple at all. I paid less than $5 here for my 8 oz. tube, and feel like I got a great bargain. The curls are shiny, bouncy, and my hair is SO soft. It's a winner!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Watery and not great quality - my heart is broken
Review: I bought this before and liked it before I learned about hair types and what good conditioners are supposed to feel like. Recently purchased again and was sad to find how terrible this product actually is.It’s very watery, which means you’ll go through the bottle quickly. Even with more product, it never actually seems to coat the hair, and does virtually nothing to detangle or give your hair any softness or silkiness.The scent is quite  strong for being one of the last ingredients. It’s a mix of pineapple and coconut, so if you’re looking to smell like an island (or a cocktail), look no further!But sadly, I’ve found better cheaper conditioners with more for my money at any drugstore.No hard feelings, Pineapple Curls. I really wanted to love you.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Moisturizing but not a thick conditioner
Review: My hair is low porosity, 3b, medium density, caucasian. My hair is weighed down easily so I like this light conditioner... it allows me to be more heavy handed with styling products, which I like. The consistency of this conditioner is rather thin and it takes a lot of product to feel like my hair is coated. And I have short hair. I like hyaluronic acid for my skin and hair, and I appreciate the curl-friendly, cruelty free ingredients. Beforehand I use a cowash or shampoo. After I rinse out the Pineapple Curls I put in leave-in conditioner. If your hair is thick or coarse in any way, you won't be satisfied with this. I can't image a lot of curly girls loving this, but if you have waves or loose curls this would be great for you.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Good stuff
Review: I have a head full of natural curly hair and for years I've been using wen. I was afraid to even you something else because my hair is so thick and coarse and I didn't think anything else would work boy was I wrong I also used to shampoo with it I'm serious when I say I didn't have high hopes but I was willing to give it a try because I'm all about not hurting a bunny to clean my hair the stuff is vegan and cruelty-free I hope that matters to you all

Title: This is counterfeit!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: NOT FOR KINKY/COILY HAIR!
Review: My hair was completely detangled and knit-free at the beginning of the washing process. After using the matching shampoo without issue, I applied this conditioner and the nightmare began. As soon as I squeezed the product through my tresses, I realized that there was a huge problem. My hair was no longer tangle-free. In fact I couldn't run my fingers through it at all. The hair was instantly deeply matted. It took 10 hours (over the span of 3 days....thank you God for the miracle of telecommuting....) to work out the tangled mess, cutting quite a bit along the way. And after all of that, I still couldn't free the last 15% and had to cut it down.I almost never leave reviews, but I had to try to help even 1 fellow Curly. IF YOU HAVE TYPE 4 COILS, THIS IS NOT YOUR PRODUCT!!! The attached picture is about 25% of what I lost (Bottle cap for scale).Curlfriend, just don't do it.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Can’t be without it.
Review: I am a long time user of just about every Pacifica product and have never been disappointed.  My hair is healthy chest level length and colored bright red. I have a mix of small banana curls, waves, stretched out curls and a few straight pieces mixed in. with NY weather any day could be an unruly or a frizz day. And I hate gel and hair spray. I keep things natural. Icurrently use the sea salt wave cream and I love it but I wanted just a touch more of a “molded hold”.  It keeps my hair soft bouncy and I truly look like so just left the beach. This pineapple cream great and is a little thicker and has a Nice hold to it which does make Are my hair a little crunchy.  I mix the two and its perfect. Just what I want a nice full fluff with a touch of hold that isn’t sticky or stiff and they both smell delicious. I Will be buying stock in them both before they discontinue any thing.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Smells yummy, lovely shine and bounce to my hair
Review: I have 2a-2c waves and loose spirals with medium thickness, porosity and texture. Most curl creams I’ve tried either weighed my hair down or made my ends look dry. I have very sensitive skin so I am picky what goes on my hair. I used about a tablespoon of this with a denman brush and got the softest, shiniest, thickest wave/curl clumps I’ve ever had. I went out in 110* heat a few hours later and minimal frizz. I am very  happy and will definitely be using this every wash day. I wish they had a pineapple gel.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Amazing product!
Review: I have been looking for a pomade that is gluten free and non toxic. I bought these pomade for my husband.  This works so well. I'm going to buy more soon!!

Title: Smells amazing!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Feels dry, it takes while to moisturize
Review: I generally LOVE Pacifica products for both contents and packaging, but this conditioner is not what I expected. When applied, it feels dry to where my hair doesn't feel like being moisturized. It took a good 5 minutes or more to have my hair feels soft. Maybe just me, but I would not buy it again. Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Wonderful hair product, but needs a seal
Review: Nice product for hair with a lovely scent and free of harsh chemicals and vegan. However, the the containers are NOT sealed. Why make such a nice product and not put a simple piece of foil or plastic? The lid came off during shipping from Amazon in their usual thin plastic one-day mailers and it spilled out all over three other items that I purchased. Please make products with a seal. That way people know that they’re getting the product that is supposed to be in the container, as packed from the manufacturer, and it’s more hygienic feeling to open a sealed product, and it doesn’t spill out all over everything resulting in product loss when shipped. Kudos to great products—Keep making wonderful products! I love all of the unique options, scents, and safer ingredients. Packaging is beautiful.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: Too light to detangle

Product: Pacifica Beauty Pineapple Curls Pomade| Hyaluronic Acid | For Curly and Textured Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate, Silicone + Paraben Free
Title: better than expected
Review: first i will disclose i used the matching shampoo and conditioner first. When my hair was still damp after my shower, I put this cream in and scrunched a bit. then I twisted it on top of my head and slept on it. When I woke up the next morning my hair was barely damp, but so soft and curly. I brushed through my hair with my fingers, scrunched a bit and went out the door (after coffee of course) I have gotten so many comments at work. The scent does fade, you won't smell like pineapple all day. The scent is actually up in the air. When the package first came I had everyone in my family smell. I smelled pineapple and so did one of my sons, My other son smelled coconut, as did my fiance. My daughter shrugged and said it smelled like pina colada. No regrets on this purchase though!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing Shampoo + Salty Waves Texturizing Conditioner | For All Hair Types | Perfect and Effortless Beach Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Adds body and texture to fine, limp hair when used occasionally
Review: I love Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Shampoo and Conditioner.  I first purchased it at Target and then found it here on Amazon for half the price.  I have fine, soft, long hair and lots of it.  I have difficulty finding products to "lift" my hair at the root and help it to look more full.  When my hair starts to get too soft or conditioned, I use this product for a couple of days and it really helps bring back the volume and bounce.  If I used it every day, it becomes harsh and over texturizes my hair leaving it dull and and rough.  So...know that this is a great once-a-week shampoo/conditioner but overuse may cause you to say goodbye to the product.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing Shampoo + Salty Waves Texturizing Conditioner | For All Hair Types | Perfect and Effortless Beach Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Surfer Waves not happening...
Review: So if you are looking for a shampoo that will help give your hair texture or enhance your natural waves or curls this is not the shampoo for you. I have naturally wavy hair and even air drying this shampoo gives me super soft FLAT hair. No texture. No nothing. I used with the conditioner and the hair balm from the liner as well.  Smells good and leaves hair clean and soft but that is it.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing Shampoo + Salty Waves Texturizing Conditioner | For All Hair Types | Perfect and Effortless Beach Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Smells Like the Cheapest of Candies
Review: This product smells exactly like those pastel-orange candies called "circus peanuts".If memory serves, they were kind of chewy, marshmallowy, and sickly sweet -- just like they smelled. If you're not familiar with them, someone mentioned artificial banana, and I think that's close. They were 99 cents a bag when I was a kid, & when you're a kid & money is tight, even cheap, crappy candy is better than no candy at all.Which brings me back to these products. I bought this shampoo & conditioner b/c after a month of stay-at-home orders, I was desperate for a little beach in my life. Sadly, unlike circus peanuts,  these products did not deliver. At the end of the day, sugar is sugar (at least when you're seven), but unless you are accustomed to eating cheap candy at the beach, there is zero relationship between these products' fragrance and any of the odors I associate with a trip to the ocean.I understand that it contains sea-derived ingredients, & perhaps that's how they derived the name, but it's still misleading.As for the products' shampooing/conditioning powers -- they are equally unimpressive. Particularly if you have hair that's prone to frizz (as I do).Oh, and it bears mentioning that the seam on the shampoo squeezie container broke on my second use.In sum, if you are looking for a fragrance that will remind you of pleasant days spent at the beach, this is not it. However, if you're looking to reminisce about the days when you could stuff your face with the cheapest of candies and still think yourself happy, this may be the product for you.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing Shampoo + Salty Waves Texturizing Conditioner | For All Hair Types | Perfect and Effortless Beach Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Would advise against it
Review: I was really disappointed with this product. I followed the directions and even used the conditioner and texturizing spray. My hair did not look any different and it dried my hair out a lot. I thought is it just my hair type but my friend who has really curly/wavy hair tried it and she felt the same. The worst part about this product is the scent. It was nauseating.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing Shampoo + Salty Waves Texturizing Conditioner | For All Hair Types | Perfect and Effortless Beach Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Lovely Banana Scent.  Leaves hair healthy!
Review: I quite love this conditioner, but I do not find it particularly enhances my wavy hair.  However, it has a yummy sweet banana scent and (more importantly) conditions my hair very well.  I don't find my hair any curlier/wavier after using it, but I do find it in particularly healthy condition.  The results are soft, quite shiny, with good body, smooth and easy to style.  It's a slightly thick conditioner, I find I use a generous amount to get it fully distributed.I generally purchase salon conditioners (I rarely find a drug store one I truly like), and I have fine, thick-ish, wavy hair that tends to be dry (and has a very closed low porosity cuticle).  My hair loves protein, and this has enough to content my hair.With any product described as "Salty," I have the concern the results will be either dry or tangly, but no product in this line produces any sort of dryness or tangliness; they all leave hair well-controlled soft, and shiny.  I'll be interested in retrying the balm and salt spray in the summer, as I think they may give more wave in warm humid weather and seem suited for air drying.  But, in the meantime, I quite love the shampoo and conditioner.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing Shampoo + Salty Waves Texturizing Conditioner | For All Hair Types | Perfect and Effortless Beach Hair | 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: So-so...not bad, but not special
Review: it's ok. basically, it's shampoo. i didn't notice anything special about it.it isn't bad, but it isn't especially amazing. i didn't notice it making my hair more or less wavy or curly.this isn't a product placement, but for my money, Sun Bum makes a curling shampoo that DOES put a noticeable wave in your hair--and it's also $9.99, so i'll be doing that from now on.this shampoo DOES smell nice, that's for sure.

I use a wrap curling iron to put a little more wave into parts of it and the conditioner helps hold that look in place really well and gives it a volume boost while still maintaining natural and healthy hair.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Hydrating and Texturizing Shampoo, Revives Dry, Damaged Hair, Vegan and Cruelty Free, 12 Fl Oz
Title: Adds body and texture to fine, limp hair when used occasionally
Review: I love Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Shampoo and Conditioner.  I first purchased it at Target and then found it here on Amazon for half the price.  I have fine, soft, long hair and lots of it.  I have difficulty finding products to "lift" my hair at the root and help it to look more full.  When my hair starts to get too soft or conditioned, I use this product for a couple of days and it really helps bring back the volume and bounce.  If I used it every day, it becomes harsh and over texturizes my hair leaving it dull and and rough.  So...know that this is a great once-a-week shampoo/conditioner but overuse may cause you to say goodbye to the product.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Hydrating and Texturizing Shampoo, Revives Dry, Damaged Hair, Vegan and Cruelty Free, 12 Fl Oz
Title: Surfer Waves not happening...
Review: So if you are looking for a shampoo that will help give your hair texture or enhance your natural waves or curls this is not the shampoo for you. I have naturally wavy hair and even air drying this shampoo gives me super soft FLAT hair. No texture. No nothing. I used with the conditioner and the hair balm from the liner as well.  Smells good and leaves hair clean and soft but that is it.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Hydrating and Texturizing Shampoo, Revives Dry, Damaged Hair, Vegan and Cruelty Free, 12 Fl Oz
Title: Smells Like the Cheapest of Candies
Review: This product smells exactly like those pastel-orange candies called "circus peanuts".If memory serves, they were kind of chewy, marshmallowy, and sickly sweet -- just like they smelled. If you're not familiar with them, someone mentioned artificial banana, and I think that's close. They were 99 cents a bag when I was a kid, & when you're a kid & money is tight, even cheap, crappy candy is better than no candy at all.Which brings me back to these products. I bought this shampoo & conditioner b/c after a month of stay-at-home orders, I was desperate for a little beach in my life. Sadly, unlike circus peanuts,  these products did not deliver. At the end of the day, sugar is sugar (at least when you're seven), but unless you are accustomed to eating cheap candy at the beach, there is zero relationship between these products' fragrance and any of the odors I associate with a trip to the ocean.I understand that it contains sea-derived ingredients, & perhaps that's how they derived the name, but it's still misleading.As for the products' shampooing/conditioning powers -- they are equally unimpressive. Particularly if you have hair that's prone to frizz (as I do).Oh, and it bears mentioning that the seam on the shampoo squeezie container broke on my second use.In sum, if you are looking for a fragrance that will remind you of pleasant days spent at the beach, this is not it. However, if you're looking to reminisce about the days when you could stuff your face with the cheapest of candies and still think yourself happy, this may be the product for you.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Hydrating and Texturizing Shampoo, Revives Dry, Damaged Hair, Vegan and Cruelty Free, 12 Fl Oz
Title: Would advise against it
Review: I was really disappointed with this product. I followed the directions and even used the conditioner and texturizing spray. My hair did not look any different and it dried my hair out a lot. I thought is it just my hair type but my friend who has really curly/wavy hair tried it and she felt the same. The worst part about this product is the scent. It was nauseating.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Hydrating and Texturizing Shampoo, Revives Dry, Damaged Hair, Vegan and Cruelty Free, 12 Fl Oz
Title: Lovely Banana Scent.  Leaves hair healthy!
Review: I quite love this conditioner, but I do not find it particularly enhances my wavy hair.  However, it has a yummy sweet banana scent and (more importantly) conditions my hair very well.  I don't find my hair any curlier/wavier after using it, but I do find it in particularly healthy condition.  The results are soft, quite shiny, with good body, smooth and easy to style.  It's a slightly thick conditioner, I find I use a generous amount to get it fully distributed.I generally purchase salon conditioners (I rarely find a drug store one I truly like), and I have fine, thick-ish, wavy hair that tends to be dry (and has a very closed low porosity cuticle).  My hair loves protein, and this has enough to content my hair.With any product described as "Salty," I have the concern the results will be either dry or tangly, but no product in this line produces any sort of dryness or tangliness; they all leave hair well-controlled soft, and shiny.  I'll be interested in retrying the balm and salt spray in the summer, as I think they may give more wave in warm humid weather and seem suited for air drying.  But, in the meantime, I quite love the shampoo and conditioner.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Hydrating and Texturizing Shampoo, Revives Dry, Damaged Hair, Vegan and Cruelty Free, 12 Fl Oz
Title: So-so...not bad, but not special
Review: it's ok. basically, it's shampoo. i didn't notice anything special about it.it isn't bad, but it isn't especially amazing. i didn't notice it making my hair more or less wavy or curly.this isn't a product placement, but for my money, Sun Bum makes a curling shampoo that DOES put a noticeable wave in your hair--and it's also $9.99, so i'll be doing that from now on.this shampoo DOES smell nice, that's for sure.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Hydrating and Texturizing Shampoo, Revives Dry, Damaged Hair, Vegan and Cruelty Free, 12 Fl Oz
Title: Healthy hair with texture!
Review: This is my new favorite conditioner- I'm on my fourth bottle! A little goes a long way. I have thick, wavy/curly hair that I love already but this takes it to another level. People I've known a long time have stopped me and told me how amazing my hair is looking in color and waves. I use a wrap curling iron to put a little more wave into parts of it and the conditioner helps hold that look in place really well and gives it a volume boost while still maintaining natural and healthy hair.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing and Moisturizing Conditioner, For All Hair Types, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 8 Fl Oz
Title: Adds body and texture to fine, limp hair when used occasionally
Review: I love Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Shampoo and Conditioner.  I first purchased it at Target and then found it here on Amazon for half the price.  I have fine, soft, long hair and lots of it.  I have difficulty finding products to "lift" my hair at the root and help it to look more full.  When my hair starts to get too soft or conditioned, I use this product for a couple of days and it really helps bring back the volume and bounce.  If I used it every day, it becomes harsh and over texturizes my hair leaving it dull and and rough.  So...know that this is a great once-a-week shampoo/conditioner but overuse may cause you to say goodbye to the product.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing and Moisturizing Conditioner, For All Hair Types, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 8 Fl Oz
Title: Surfer Waves not happening...
Review: So if you are looking for a shampoo that will help give your hair texture or enhance your natural waves or curls this is not the shampoo for you. I have naturally wavy hair and even air drying this shampoo gives me super soft FLAT hair. No texture. No nothing. I used with the conditioner and the hair balm from the liner as well.  Smells good and leaves hair clean and soft but that is it.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing and Moisturizing Conditioner, For All Hair Types, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 8 Fl Oz
Title: Smells Like the Cheapest of Candies
Review: This product smells exactly like those pastel-orange candies called "circus peanuts".If memory serves, they were kind of chewy, marshmallowy, and sickly sweet -- just like they smelled. If you're not familiar with them, someone mentioned artificial banana, and I think that's close. They were 99 cents a bag when I was a kid, & when you're a kid & money is tight, even cheap, crappy candy is better than no candy at all.Which brings me back to these products. I bought this shampoo & conditioner b/c after a month of stay-at-home orders, I was desperate for a little beach in my life. Sadly, unlike circus peanuts,  these products did not deliver. At the end of the day, sugar is sugar (at least when you're seven), but unless you are accustomed to eating cheap candy at the beach, there is zero relationship between these products' fragrance and any of the odors I associate with a trip to the ocean.I understand that it contains sea-derived ingredients, & perhaps that's how they derived the name, but it's still misleading.As for the products' shampooing/conditioning powers -- they are equally unimpressive. Particularly if you have hair that's prone to frizz (as I do).Oh, and it bears mentioning that the seam on the shampoo squeezie container broke on my second use.In sum, if you are looking for a fragrance that will remind you of pleasant days spent at the beach, this is not it. However, if you're looking to reminisce about the days when you could stuff your face with the cheapest of candies and still think yourself happy, this may be the product for you.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing and Moisturizing Conditioner, For All Hair Types, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 8 Fl Oz
Title: Would advise against it
Review: I was really disappointed with this product. I followed the directions and even used the conditioner and texturizing spray. My hair did not look any different and it dried my hair out a lot. I thought is it just my hair type but my friend who has really curly/wavy hair tried it and she felt the same. The worst part about this product is the scent. It was nauseating.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing and Moisturizing Conditioner, For All Hair Types, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 8 Fl Oz
Title: Lovely Banana Scent.  Leaves hair healthy!
Review: I quite love this conditioner, but I do not find it particularly enhances my wavy hair.  However, it has a yummy sweet banana scent and (more importantly) conditions my hair very well.  I don't find my hair any curlier/wavier after using it, but I do find it in particularly healthy condition.  The results are soft, quite shiny, with good body, smooth and easy to style.  It's a slightly thick conditioner, I find I use a generous amount to get it fully distributed.I generally purchase salon conditioners (I rarely find a drug store one I truly like), and I have fine, thick-ish, wavy hair that tends to be dry (and has a very closed low porosity cuticle).  My hair loves protein, and this has enough to content my hair.With any product described as "Salty," I have the concern the results will be either dry or tangly, but no product in this line produces any sort of dryness or tangliness; they all leave hair well-controlled soft, and shiny.  I'll be interested in retrying the balm and salt spray in the summer, as I think they may give more wave in warm humid weather and seem suited for air drying.  But, in the meantime, I quite love the shampoo and conditioner.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing and Moisturizing Conditioner, For All Hair Types, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 8 Fl Oz
Title: So-so...not bad, but not special
Review: it's ok. basically, it's shampoo. i didn't notice anything special about it.it isn't bad, but it isn't especially amazing. i didn't notice it making my hair more or less wavy or curly.this isn't a product placement, but for my money, Sun Bum makes a curling shampoo that DOES put a noticeable wave in your hair--and it's also $9.99, so i'll be doing that from now on.this shampoo DOES smell nice, that's for sure.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing and Moisturizing Conditioner, For All Hair Types, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 8 Fl Oz
Title: Healthy hair with texture!
Review: This is my new favorite conditioner- I'm on my fourth bottle! A little goes a long way. I have thick, wavy/curly hair that I love already but this takes it to another level. People I've known a long time have stopped me and told me how amazing my hair is looking in color and waves. I use a wrap curling iron to put a little more wave into parts of it and the conditioner helps hold that look in place really well and gives it a volume boost while still maintaining natural and healthy hair.

Title: Amazing scent and feel

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing and Moisturizing Conditioner, For All Hair Types, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 8 Fl Oz
Title: Smells great
Review: Great packaging. Smells great and helps volumize my thick hair. Also love their salty waves shampoo.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texturizing and Moisturizing Conditioner, For All Hair Types, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 8 Fl Oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: El olor es muy fuerte y muy feo, ya que se seca huele mejor. Sí deja buena textura en el pelo.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Just what I was looking for. Definition, separation and smoothing for mermaid hair!
Review: Fantastic. Provides hydration, smoothing, separation of curl clumps and definition. I have 2b-2c low porosity hair and was looking for definition and texture. Gives just that. Though if your are looking for beachy waves/tousled, it’d be best to use a beach spray, which I use for volume occasionally. Smell is light, which is great if you layer products.  I will use this product every wash day for as long as it’s available! Love it!I use it on wash day after shampoo, conditioner and leave in. Apply gel afterwards to hold the curls till next wash day. On 2-3 day hair I put a dime sized amount in my palm and a splash of water and gently smooth over the canopy of my hair. Curls come back to life, frizzies calm down and mermaid hair comes back! The protein in this works to spring the curl back up.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: I want to order more!!
Review: I was a little hesitant about buying this after reading reviews. I have VERY thick course hair, that's also curly when wet but dries straight and frizzy. Most of the reviews weren't very good, but I took the chance. I washed my hair and put this on after I towel dried it. The smell was heavy of bananas but with a tropical twist. It came out a little thich, but went over my hair very nicely. Though I used more than I should have, like 2 quarter size bits. I had my daughter put dutch braids in my hair and left them in for well over 12 hours. I got home the next morning after work took my hair down and my hair was actually wavy and so soft to the touch. I've now been using this for over a week and I gotta say I absolutely love it. The only reason I'm giving a 4 star is because it does give it a lot of volume, which I already have enough of. I'm not sure why everyone is saying they smell like a big banana, because I certainly don't. I guess the smell of my shampoo and conditioner is just as strong so I don't smell what everyone else does. I have also used this on my hair while it's been dry and it does give it a more textured look to it.UPDATE: using this products for 2 weeks now. I have decreased the size amount that I am using because it did way down my hair. I have been using it after I get out of the shower on my towle dried hair. I put maybe a dime size amount in my pamls and work it through root to ends. My hair is still drying straight but still not frizzy, but yet this does not give me beachy waves. Still my hair is soft. IDK if I want to try and return it or not.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Love Pacifica
Review: I Love Pacifica’s products so I wanted to give this a try. It does what it claims and the good thing is you can use it on wet or dry hair. I have dry hair so I do use this on my dry hair and it makes your hair soft and kind of  textured. The reason I gave four stars instead of five is because it said it has a banana scent and it doesn’t , it does have a scent but it very hard to smell. Which some people will love, but because it is a beach product I was hoping for a nice smell. It’s possible it just has set on the shelf for a while.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: works great
Review: I have naturally curly frizzy hair. This product works wonders on my hair. It makes the curls into rings if I want to go natural instead of frizz. But if I want to straighten out, it makes my hair look fuller. Nice product.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: uhhhh  what?
Review: It absolutely did NOTHING! I have very wavy AND frizzy natural perm hair.  So without any product, if I braded my hair, it still gives me pretty nice wave and last all day.  But because I dance and sweat, I wanted so have something that my best look last all day.  Guess what? I undone my braded hair, it was just as usual without this product. And yes, it didn't hold shape during dancing.  What is this for?  ??????  no i never purchase again.  for what? Right?

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Not great for thick course hair
Review: This might work well for thinner hair, but it made my thick course hair feel damaged and tangled.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Okay
Review: I like the smell of this product, and I love that it is EWG-certified, but it does just an okay job on my hair. I don't think it's game-changing in terms of reducing frizz or creating nice waves. May work better for other hair types, however? I have pretty standard hair - not too thick or thin - and rarely use heat on it.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Nice product
Review: Love this. I have fine hair and use this on towel dried hair. Then blow dry and my hair is wavy but not sticky. I also use it on dry hair. Love it. Worth the price

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: OK Product
Review: I was looking for a product to replace NYM Beach Babe Texturizing Hair (which apparently they have stopped making.)  I was leery about the scent but it is pleasant and not overpowering.  Light texturizing but not the beachy texture I wanted. This product does not provide the bite/hold I was looking for.  I love that it is vegan and does not contain chemicals.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Love Pacifica hair products!
Review: I use this dry on my wavy curly hair. I need it to provide moisture and to fluff and refresh my hair on days I don't wash. Only a small amount is necessary. I love Pacifica products for my hair. I also use the coconut shampoo and salty waves conditioner (which does not have salt). The girl who was doing my foil highlights asked me what I used. She said my hair was in good condition!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Not for straight hair
Review: Not impressed. I have fine, straight hair that is long and thick. If I use a small amount this product does nothing for my hair. If I used a bit more, it leaves my hair greasy and limp.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Is it really salty waves?
Review: I can't ever tell if my hair is barely waving because of it's own little kinky quirks or because I put Salty Waves in it. There is ZERO hold to speak of and this MUST be used in tandem with another product if you want any results to occur in your hair. I found it to be a waste of my money

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Love this brand!
Review: My hair has been getting softer over time and more manageable. The smell is relaxing. I use this balm directly after a shower and then either braid or put it in a ponytail. It helps to reduce frizzies.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Great product!
Review: Works well on my fine hair in the very dry California environment. Encourages my natural curls, and add a shine to my hair, has a mild conditioner and styling gel.  Love the product.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Helps tame the frizz and calm my curls to be more wavy.
Review: Love this for my curly hair. It helps tame the frizz and calm my curls to be more wavy.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Perfect for frizz
Review: I have very curly, but also very fine hair, so frizz control is major.  I find with this product I can actually let my hair air dry without ending up with a ball of frizz on my head.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Hair is finally smooth, not frizzy!
Review: So happy with this hair cream! I have curly hair that only frizzes when I let it air dry, and this product calms the frizz and gives my hair the natural air-dried waves I’ve always wanted! My hair does not feel sticky or crunchy like the typical moose foam - it’s smooth and soft! I’m not crazy about the banana smell, but it goes away once my hair dries. Definitely recommend this product!

Title: Beautiful beach waves!

A friend recommended I try this product and I’m glad she did. A little bit of this balm goes a long way. It brought out lovely beachy waves, kept it smooth, and no sticky residue. It’s a winner!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Beach Hair Styling Balm, Vegan & Cruelty Free, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Nice and smoothing
Review: I like this and use it after every hair wash. My hair gets frizzy if I don't use a product in it, and this one does a great job.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Yuck
Review: To start, I LOVE Pacifica. It's cruelty free and their products are natural and usually great. I've tried several sprays for waves (my hair is thick and curly/wavy). My favorite is Alterna's so far. The result of this spray is just like putting really salty water on your hair- it doesn't cause waves, it just causes really dry, salty hair. I really appreciate that Amazon refunded this so easily.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Love this stuff
Review: This stuff is amazing. If you want texture and hair that has body, you need this. I have straight, thin hair and this is the only thing that gives me lift.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Beach party in a bottle!
Review: This product delivers beautiful waves and texture. I have a lot of hair, but it is slippery and fine. Beauty Salty Waves delivers both volume and texture, reminding me of the lovely days of my youth spent on Oahu, cliff diving at the Point and body surfing at Sandy Beach. A couple spritzes delivers an instant, care-free vibe. It’s a beach party in a bottle!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Not Quite Right for My Hair
Review: I have very frizzy, curly, unruly curls, so my hairdresser suggested I try sea salt spray.  I tried the Captain Blankenship Mermaid product and I loved it, but I thought it was a little pricey. The next time around, I thought I would try something else.  Pacifica makes good products, and I have liked everything I've bought from them in the past.  Their products are always cruelty free and vegan friendly, which appeals to me very much.  I tried this particular product, and although it smells nice and is gentle, it just didn't give my curls enough definition.  Might work better for someone else.  I am going back to the Mermaid product, though.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Doesn't seem to work with fine hair
Review: I thought this might add some texture to my fine hair.  I tried this a couple times varying the amount of product I used.  This seemed to weigh down my hair and make it look almost greasy.  I do have very fine hair though.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Makes me feel like a sexy beach goddess
Review: Although this is pretty much just salt and water with some fragrances added, I love it!It works and leaves my hair smelling nice. The end of the day my hair looks just as good as when I left the house.I have naturally thick wavy hair that fizzes during the day if I don't add product or straighten it.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Awesome!
Review: I really like this spray! I tried it on we and dry hair. Dry hair it doesn't work too well for me but in damp hair it's amazing. It really brings out my natural waves. I would definatly buy this again

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz

I don't have frizzy hair. I used it for the first time last night on damp hair as it says and it added no wave or anything. Just knotted and frizzy and leaves urnhair feeling GROSS. I can't even get a brush through it right now. Horrible product. Do not buy this. The other reviews are wrong.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz

I normally have mostly straight slightly wavy-ish hair and I sprayed this after towel drying last night and as a touch up this morning.  Looks amazing compared to other similar products I’ve used and doesn’t feel sticky or crunchy. Run don’t walk to your computer and order this!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Nice Natural Texturizer

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz

Review: Good grief. How stupid have humans become? People are really paying $15 for a bottle of what is literally just *saltwater*?

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz
Title: Probably better for thin hair

It does smell nice, though, and the scent lasts all day. It smells like a very light, fruity banana smell. I think this would probably work great for someone thin or fine hair

Product: Pacifica Beauty Salty Waves Texture Spray, 4 Fl Oz

Review: I was running out of this product and tried several others w no luck at all. I was happy to find this on Amazon. It is easy to use and my hair does not look greasy or feel crunchy at all. It’s perfect. I spray my hair when it’s wet and then scrunch it up w my hands and go.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: Don't do it!!!!!!
Review: UPDATE 04/21/2021:God awful shampoo! It smelled good, it's clean, but whatever they put in it weighed down my hair and caused so much product buildup I had to go to a salon to get it out. It took 2 cleanses to get *most* of the product out. The hair stylist literally said it looked as though I hadn't washed my hair in 3 weeks when in reality I had been scrubbing for at least a week trying to get it out on my own. Now it could just be me and my hair, but I wouldn't risk it if I were you. This shampoo isn't that amazing. It just smells like coconut in the end.Original 5 star review:I bought this product along with the conditioner after finding out OGX had ingredients in it that when mixed with water create formaldehyde.I wanted something vegan and clean, something I could use and not worry if it'll give me a tumor 10 years down the road.The ingredient list is safe and the shampoo smells great! My hair is a little more greasy than normal but I think it's from switching products. It's definitely worth a shot!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: Watch out for silicone! False advertising!
Review: I originally bout this conditioner because it was the only one I could find that did not have silicone, mind you I bought it a little over a year ago. At that time it was hard to find a conditioner or shampoo that was free of silicones, sulfate free, and paraben free. I came to realize their ingredients is VERY different that what they are advertising here, and the 4th ingredient is dimethicone, which is silicone. Bad, bad, bad. Products with this in them dry the living hell out of my scalp and hair, I am very disappointed in Pacifica for falsely advertising to me.These days there are regular brands of shampoo and conditioner like Garnier and others that make silicone and sulfate free shampoo and conditioner, you don’t have to search anymore and I will just look elsewhere.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: I am SUPER allergic and everything makes me itch
Review: I am SUPER allergic and everything makes me itch. So far, I have been able to use Pacifica hair products with out having a reaction. They also work well on my curly hair.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: Moisturizing with it weighing down
Review: I have been looking for an everyday conditioner that doesn't way my hair down, and keeps my curls moisturized.  So far after a week it's been working well, my hair is slightly damaged at the ends and oily at the roots, combining this with the banana mask has been working wonders on my hair.  Very satisfied and would highly recommend.  The added bonus of the smell is like a summer day at the beach everyday.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: Great shampoo, but faulty cap - shampoo leaked out.
Review: Received replacement shampoo and used shampoo + conditioner today.I am VERY surprised at how smooth the two Pacifica products made my long, naturally curly/frizzy hair. I can't recall the last time my hair felt so soft, manageable and without that heavy feel. Both products rinsed out quickly, with minimal hair in the drain strainer.Normally alternate between Pantene, TRESemmé and L'Oreal Extraordinary Clay, since it's never a good idea to use the same shampoo / conditioner continuously.Of the four shampoos / conditioners listed, Pacifica Coconut Power Strong and Long, gave the best results. The L'Oreal is comparable to minimal hair in the drain, but the conditioner is extremely difficult to rinse out, even with the hard water we have.Hopefully, the results will always be this favorable, but at least for now, I found a very nice shampoo and conditioner, in Pacifica. The coconut scent is also very pleasant - not overwhelming.Why liquid items are not sealed properly is a mystery to me. Cap is defective (see image) and was delivered with shampoo leaking inside and outside of box.When the cap is in the CLOSED position, there is a gap on the opposite side of the opening, which was crystal clear after washing all the soap and dirt off the cap. The cap does not seal properly. When it's in the fully CLOSED position, the front of the cap opens. Leaked out of both ends.See attached image.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: Did not work for my hair
Review: I really wanted to love this product since I'm trying to use better ingredients on my body and hair. I love that it's cruelty free and vegan, and I liked the smell too.Unfortunately, I wouldn't buy this again. I needed to use a lot to cover my long hair, there was very little lather, and it left my hair looking dull and greasy, while feeling dry at the same time. It was more expensive than any other shampoo I've used too. I guess I'll have to continue my search for a shampoo that works better for my hair.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: Shiny and soft hair for the first time in my life.
Review: Hands down the best conditioner I've ever used. My hair is silky and shiny for the first time in my life. I have been dying my hair for years, and this has helped it heal. I noticed it after the first wash. I am in love and will never go back.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: Almost like therapy....
Review: I would marry this shampoo and conditioner if one could marry inanimate objects and polygamy wasn't illegal. My hair is very grateful for this purchase and happy hair means happy me. I just moved to an area with exceedingly hard water and my hair was starting to suffer greatly. Dull, dry, falling out and just plain depressing to deal with and look at. We were considering splitting and separating completely. Just one "treatment session" with this combination of therapists promises a brighter future for my hair and thus myself. Soothing and pleasant aromatherapy was added as a bonus, which puts it on another level. Hopefully, we will see continued improvement in the health and relationship between my hair and me.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: Meh
Review: Not my favorite. Love Pacifica and wanted to give their hair care a try. I have fine hair and didn't think it detangled well (which I would expect from conditioner). Don't feel like it did the repair work it advertised. It's okay, but would not re-buy. Lots of other natural, cruelty-free conditioner options that work better.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have straight colored/highlighted hair. Although my hair is in pretty good condition, the ends tend to get a little more dry and unruly. I've tried lots of products to fix this problem. The best one is now no longer available. This conditioner from Pacifica is great though! It smells so nice with the coconut scent and it made my hair feel silky in the shower. It also helped my hair look better on the ends. Not 100% fixed, but much better. I liked it so much that I ordered the shampoo. Recommended.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: I really want to like this
Review: I really want to like this conditioner.  It has all the stuff I want, Vegan and Cruelty free.  Plus it has a lot of the filler stuff you don't want in your hair.  It smells so good.  It has a nice weight to it.  But when I put it in my hair, it disappears.  It doesn't spread very well.  And then when I wash it out my hair feels so dry.  To be fair, I have extremely long hair, it's thickish, kind of curly, and mostly grey.  I have to put oil and other moisturizing products in my hair.  I have this on auto ship and will continue to work with it.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Coconut Power Strong & Long Moisturizing Shampoo for Dry + Damaged Hair, 100% Vegan & Cruelty Free, Sulfate + Paraben Free, White, 2 Count
Title: Hair Feels Worse
Review: Update, 1/3/22: My hair feels worse than before. It's dry and lacks shine. The shampoo's consistency is very watery (maybe it's suppose to be watery, Idk), but it takes me about three tries to get my head cleaned. Smells good, so it has that going for it.~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•Arrived in a timely manner, but it spilled. Shampoo bottle was open.

The smell is nice but even that seems diluted. My hair does not have that fresh, clean feeling and smell after washing it. I hate this shampoo!
