Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Don't do it!!!!!!
Review: UPDATE 04/21/2021:God awful shampoo! It smelled good, it's clean, but whatever they put in it weighed down my hair and caused so much product buildup I had to go to a salon to get it out. It took 2 cleanses to get *most* of the product out. The hair stylist literally said it looked as though I hadn't washed my hair in 3 weeks when in reality I had been scrubbing for at least a week trying to get it out on my own. Now it could just be me and my hair, but I wouldn't risk it if I were you. This shampoo isn't that amazing. It just smells like coconut in the end.Original 5 star review:I bought this product along with the conditioner after finding out OGX had ingredients in it that when mixed with water create formaldehyde.I wanted something vegan and clean, something I could use and not worry if it'll give me a tumor 10 years down the road.The ingredient list is safe and the shampoo smells great! My hair is a little more greasy than normal but I think it's from switching products. It's definitely worth a shot!

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Watch out for silicone! False advertising!
Review: I originally bout this conditioner because it was the only one I could find that did not have silicone, mind you I bought it a little over a year ago. At that time it was hard to find a conditioner or shampoo that was free of silicones, sulfate free, and paraben free. I came to realize their ingredients is VERY different that what they are advertising here, and the 4th ingredient is dimethicone, which is silicone. Bad, bad, bad. Products with this in them dry the living hell out of my scalp and hair, I am very disappointed in Pacifica for falsely advertising to me.These days there are regular brands of shampoo and conditioner like Garnier and others that make silicone and sulfate free shampoo and conditioner, you don’t have to search anymore and I will just look elsewhere.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: I am SUPER allergic and everything makes me itch
Review: I am SUPER allergic and everything makes me itch. So far, I have been able to use Pacifica hair products with out having a reaction. They also work well on my curly hair.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Moisturizing with it weighing down
Review: I have been looking for an everyday conditioner that doesn't way my hair down, and keeps my curls moisturized.  So far after a week it's been working well, my hair is slightly damaged at the ends and oily at the roots, combining this with the banana mask has been working wonders on my hair.  Very satisfied and would highly recommend.  The added bonus of the smell is like a summer day at the beach everyday.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Great shampoo, but faulty cap - shampoo leaked out.
Review: Received replacement shampoo and used shampoo + conditioner today.I am VERY surprised at how smooth the two Pacifica products made my long, naturally curly/frizzy hair. I can't recall the last time my hair felt so soft, manageable and without that heavy feel. Both products rinsed out quickly, with minimal hair in the drain strainer.Normally alternate between Pantene, TRESemmé and L'Oreal Extraordinary Clay, since it's never a good idea to use the same shampoo / conditioner continuously.Of the four shampoos / conditioners listed, Pacifica Coconut Power Strong and Long, gave the best results. The L'Oreal is comparable to minimal hair in the drain, but the conditioner is extremely difficult to rinse out, even with the hard water we have.Hopefully, the results will always be this favorable, but at least for now, I found a very nice shampoo and conditioner, in Pacifica. The coconut scent is also very pleasant - not overwhelming.Why liquid items are not sealed properly is a mystery to me. Cap is defective (see image) and was delivered with shampoo leaking inside and outside of box.When the cap is in the CLOSED position, there is a gap on the opposite side of the opening, which was crystal clear after washing all the soap and dirt off the cap. The cap does not seal properly. When it's in the fully CLOSED position, the front of the cap opens. Leaked out of both ends.See attached image.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Did not work for my hair
Review: I really wanted to love this product since I'm trying to use better ingredients on my body and hair. I love that it's cruelty free and vegan, and I liked the smell too.Unfortunately, I wouldn't buy this again. I needed to use a lot to cover my long hair, there was very little lather, and it left my hair looking dull and greasy, while feeling dry at the same time. It was more expensive than any other shampoo I've used too. I guess I'll have to continue my search for a shampoo that works better for my hair.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Shiny and soft hair for the first time in my life.
Review: Hands down the best conditioner I've ever used. My hair is silky and shiny for the first time in my life. I have been dying my hair for years, and this has helped it heal. I noticed it after the first wash. I am in love and will never go back.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Almost like therapy....
Review: I would marry this shampoo and conditioner if one could marry inanimate objects and polygamy wasn't illegal. My hair is very grateful for this purchase and happy hair means happy me. I just moved to an area with exceedingly hard water and my hair was starting to suffer greatly. Dull, dry, falling out and just plain depressing to deal with and look at. We were considering splitting and separating completely. Just one "treatment session" with this combination of therapists promises a brighter future for my hair and thus myself. Soothing and pleasant aromatherapy was added as a bonus, which puts it on another level. Hopefully, we will see continued improvement in the health and relationship between my hair and me.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Meh
Review: Not my favorite. Love Pacifica and wanted to give their hair care a try. I have fine hair and didn't think it detangled well (which I would expect from conditioner). Don't feel like it did the repair work it advertised. It's okay, but would not re-buy. Lots of other natural, cruelty-free conditioner options that work better.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have straight colored/highlighted hair. Although my hair is in pretty good condition, the ends tend to get a little more dry and unruly. I've tried lots of products to fix this problem. The best one is now no longer available. This conditioner from Pacifica is great though! It smells so nice with the coconut scent and it made my hair feel silky in the shower. It also helped my hair look better on the ends. Not 100% fixed, but much better. I liked it so much that I ordered the shampoo. Recommended.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: I really want to like this
Review: I really want to like this conditioner.  It has all the stuff I want, Vegan and Cruelty free.  Plus it has a lot of the filler stuff you don't want in your hair.  It smells so good.  It has a nice weight to it.  But when I put it in my hair, it disappears.  It doesn't spread very well.  And then when I wash it out my hair feels so dry.  To be fair, I have extremely long hair, it's thickish, kind of curly, and mostly grey.  I have to put oil and other moisturizing products in my hair.  I have this on auto ship and will continue to work with it.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Hair Feels Worse
Review: Update, 1/3/22: My hair feels worse than before. It's dry and lacks shine. The shampoo's consistency is very watery (maybe it's suppose to be watery, Idk), but it takes me about three tries to get my head cleaned. Smells good, so it has that going for it.~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•Arrived in a timely manner, but it spilled. Shampoo bottle was open.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Awful! So runny!
Review: Awful! This shampoo is so thin and watery! I have to pour 3 big handfuls of shampoo every time I wash my hair because it does not lather up...just feels like wet hair. I have a short (less than shoulder length) style. For the price I paid for this shampoo I would expect much better quality. I have no idea how it got 4.5 stars. The smell is nice but even that seems diluted. My hair does not have that fresh, clean feeling and smell after washing it. I hate this shampoo!

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Arrived open
Review: I can’t tell if the bottle just broke in transit or if it’s been used, but I didn’t find a safety seal anywhere. I’m hesitant to use it because of this.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: I love this conditioner
Review: I really like how this conditioner and the shampoo clean and condition my long hair with a little bit of damage on the ends...haven't cut my hair in a really long time. The smell is a little too sweet smelling for me kinda like coconut vanilla sugar scent. My hair looks and feels great and smell isnt over powering after your hair dries.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Happy costumer
Review: I love all the Pacifica products, especially their shampoos and conditioners, seen I started to use shampoos and conditioners without sulfate my hair is more healthy, shine, the ends they do not break like before, also after I color my hair keep the color in good condition and do not fade it. Thanks Pacifica for great products.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear
Title: Smells great!
Review: I have long curly hair that tangles. This shampoo and conditioner has cut down on how much hair I actually loose in the shower. It smells like a tropical vacation and Pacifica is great for the environment with no animal testing. Love them. Check out their tinted sunscreen spray and colored lip sunscreens. Coral reef safe.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Shampoo - Coconut Power 12 oz, Clear

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Don't do it!!!!!!
Review: UPDATE 04/21/2021:God awful shampoo! It smelled good, it's clean, but whatever they put in it weighed down my hair and caused so much product buildup I had to go to a salon to get it out. It took 2 cleanses to get *most* of the product out. The hair stylist literally said it looked as though I hadn't washed my hair in 3 weeks when in reality I had been scrubbing for at least a week trying to get it out on my own. Now it could just be me and my hair, but I wouldn't risk it if I were you. This shampoo isn't that amazing. It just smells like coconut in the end.Original 5 star review:I bought this product along with the conditioner after finding out OGX had ingredients in it that when mixed with water create formaldehyde.I wanted something vegan and clean, something I could use and not worry if it'll give me a tumor 10 years down the road.The ingredient list is safe and the shampoo smells great! My hair is a little more greasy than normal but I think it's from switching products. It's definitely worth a shot!

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Watch out for silicone! False advertising!
Review: I originally bout this conditioner because it was the only one I could find that did not have silicone, mind you I bought it a little over a year ago. At that time it was hard to find a conditioner or shampoo that was free of silicones, sulfate free, and paraben free. I came to realize their ingredients is VERY different that what they are advertising here, and the 4th ingredient is dimethicone, which is silicone. Bad, bad, bad. Products with this in them dry the living hell out of my scalp and hair, I am very disappointed in Pacifica for falsely advertising to me.These days there are regular brands of shampoo and conditioner like Garnier and others that make silicone and sulfate free shampoo and conditioner, you don’t have to search anymore and I will just look elsewhere.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: I am SUPER allergic and everything makes me itch
Review: I am SUPER allergic and everything makes me itch. So far, I have been able to use Pacifica hair products with out having a reaction. They also work well on my curly hair.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Moisturizing with it weighing down
Review: I have been looking for an everyday conditioner that doesn't way my hair down, and keeps my curls moisturized.  So far after a week it's been working well, my hair is slightly damaged at the ends and oily at the roots, combining this with the banana mask has been working wonders on my hair.  Very satisfied and would highly recommend.  The added bonus of the smell is like a summer day at the beach everyday.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Great shampoo, but faulty cap - shampoo leaked out.
Review: Received replacement shampoo and used shampoo + conditioner today.I am VERY surprised at how smooth the two Pacifica products made my long, naturally curly/frizzy hair. I can't recall the last time my hair felt so soft, manageable and without that heavy feel. Both products rinsed out quickly, with minimal hair in the drain strainer.Normally alternate between Pantene, TRESemmé and L'Oreal Extraordinary Clay, since it's never a good idea to use the same shampoo / conditioner continuously.Of the four shampoos / conditioners listed, Pacifica Coconut Power Strong and Long, gave the best results. The L'Oreal is comparable to minimal hair in the drain, but the conditioner is extremely difficult to rinse out, even with the hard water we have.Hopefully, the results will always be this favorable, but at least for now, I found a very nice shampoo and conditioner, in Pacifica. The coconut scent is also very pleasant - not overwhelming.Why liquid items are not sealed properly is a mystery to me. Cap is defective (see image) and was delivered with shampoo leaking inside and outside of box.When the cap is in the CLOSED position, there is a gap on the opposite side of the opening, which was crystal clear after washing all the soap and dirt off the cap. The cap does not seal properly. When it's in the fully CLOSED position, the front of the cap opens. Leaked out of both ends.See attached image.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Did not work for my hair
Review: I really wanted to love this product since I'm trying to use better ingredients on my body and hair. I love that it's cruelty free and vegan, and I liked the smell too.Unfortunately, I wouldn't buy this again. I needed to use a lot to cover my long hair, there was very little lather, and it left my hair looking dull and greasy, while feeling dry at the same time. It was more expensive than any other shampoo I've used too. I guess I'll have to continue my search for a shampoo that works better for my hair.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Shiny and soft hair for the first time in my life.
Review: Hands down the best conditioner I've ever used. My hair is silky and shiny for the first time in my life. I have been dying my hair for years, and this has helped it heal. I noticed it after the first wash. I am in love and will never go back.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Almost like therapy....
Review: I would marry this shampoo and conditioner if one could marry inanimate objects and polygamy wasn't illegal. My hair is very grateful for this purchase and happy hair means happy me. I just moved to an area with exceedingly hard water and my hair was starting to suffer greatly. Dull, dry, falling out and just plain depressing to deal with and look at. We were considering splitting and separating completely. Just one "treatment session" with this combination of therapists promises a brighter future for my hair and thus myself. Soothing and pleasant aromatherapy was added as a bonus, which puts it on another level. Hopefully, we will see continued improvement in the health and relationship between my hair and me.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Meh
Review: Not my favorite. Love Pacifica and wanted to give their hair care a try. I have fine hair and didn't think it detangled well (which I would expect from conditioner). Don't feel like it did the repair work it advertised. It's okay, but would not re-buy. Lots of other natural, cruelty-free conditioner options that work better.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have straight colored/highlighted hair. Although my hair is in pretty good condition, the ends tend to get a little more dry and unruly. I've tried lots of products to fix this problem. The best one is now no longer available. This conditioner from Pacifica is great though! It smells so nice with the coconut scent and it made my hair feel silky in the shower. It also helped my hair look better on the ends. Not 100% fixed, but much better. I liked it so much that I ordered the shampoo. Recommended.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: I really want to like this
Review: I really want to like this conditioner.  It has all the stuff I want, Vegan and Cruelty free.  Plus it has a lot of the filler stuff you don't want in your hair.  It smells so good.  It has a nice weight to it.  But when I put it in my hair, it disappears.  It doesn't spread very well.  And then when I wash it out my hair feels so dry.  To be fair, I have extremely long hair, it's thickish, kind of curly, and mostly grey.  I have to put oil and other moisturizing products in my hair.  I have this on auto ship and will continue to work with it.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Hair Feels Worse
Review: Update, 1/3/22: My hair feels worse than before. It's dry and lacks shine. The shampoo's consistency is very watery (maybe it's suppose to be watery, Idk), but it takes me about three tries to get my head cleaned. Smells good, so it has that going for it.~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•~•Arrived in a timely manner, but it spilled. Shampoo bottle was open.

Product: Pacifica Strong and Long Moisturizing Conditioner - Coconut Power 8 oz
Title: Awful! So runny!
Review: Awful! This shampoo is so thin and watery! I have to pour 3 big handfuls of shampoo every time I wash my hair because it does not lather up...just feels like wet hair. I have a short (less than shoulder length) style. For the price I paid for this shampoo I would expect much better quality. I have no idea how it got 4.5 stars. The smell is nice but even that seems diluted. My hair does not have that fresh, clean feeling and smell after washing it. I hate this shampoo!

Product: Pacifica Coconut milk detangle elixir, 7 Fl Oz
Title: It might be an authentic product.
Review: I found this product at Target and it smelled amazing and I wanted to try it, but checkout line was long so I ordered on Amazon instead. The packaging looks and feels like standard Pacifica packaging (I have many of their products). The product also smells almost exactly like it did in the store (we are talking a very strong coconut scent). My only concern that makes me question the legitimacy of this product is the thickness. If you look inside the bottle, it appears to be a white cream. The product at Target was definitely more liquid than this, something akin to a thick serum.  I did shake the bottle to see if maybe some components had separated but when I rechecked the consistency, it definitely still looked like a cream. Even though the one I received appears thicker, the trigger spray delivers product without issue and the product itself is nice and working well. Overall I'm happy with it and will continue to use the product but will likely not purchase it through Amazon again.

Product: Pacifica Coconut milk detangle elixir, 7 Fl Oz
Title: Ew
Review: UPDATE: I actually had to throw my brush away cuz I couldn’t get the smell out….. I washed it TWICE with shampoo and scrubbed it with a toothbrush and it still had the smell from this product on it.This stuff stinks. I really wanted to like this cuz I love this brand but….. it’s a no for me. I’m going to be really honest: in the bottle it smells like sour coconut milk….. put it in your hair and it smells like sweaty balls….. not gonna lie… makes your hair soft though but I CANNOT get past the smell! Would not buy again and do NOT recommend

Product: Pacifica Coconut milk detangle elixir, 7 Fl Oz
Title: Lightweight - Tames frizz without greasy look
Review: I have lots of fine blonde hair with a slight natural wave. It will lightly frizz in humidity and I look scruffy. Conditioner alone won't stop the frizz.I use this pretty liberally after the shower. Brush it through. It leaves my hair much less frizz-prone, but also not weighted down like many heavier products that my fine hair can't take.It smells nice and light, not overly perfumed.  Surprised ho much I love this product - been consistently using it for 2 years!

Product: Pacifica Coconut milk detangle elixir, 7 Fl Oz
Title: Smells great!
Review: This detangler smells wonderful and works very well. I love Pacifica products and this one didn’t let me down. My only complaint is the nozzle, I wish it sprayed out more of a wide mist instead of a direct stream of product, but overall I recommend and will continue to use.

Product: Pacifica Coconut milk detangle elixir, 7 Fl Oz
Title: Love this!
Review: I really like product, I don't think there is a Pacifica product I haven't liked. The scent is great, although now that I think about it, it's almost like a 'cheap' coconut smell at first, but once it's on your hair for a while the smell wears off to a better coconut smell in my opinion. I tend not to have any luck with these kind of sprayers.. they always seem to clog with products (for some reason every product I've had with these sprayers are thick ?) For one use the sprayer didn't work and then just started working again/ the product does to as says and detangles like it should/ Ive never sprayed on dry hair-only after washing with towel dried hair, I've used on my roots,length,and ends and there's no issue with stiffness any where like with someone leave in detangle product, with some I can feel the texture left on my hair or like a film almost. Not with this. I coulr see it maybe leaning towards that if over used. But I've have no problem with it! I spray on towel dried hair, brush it out and either towel dry and do heatless curls over night / air dry and straighten the next day. And either way my hair is always soft and manageable the following day. And that says alot! My hair tangles very easy!! I've used this several times before writing the review just so I could get a good grasp on it before sharing my opinion. Also!! My hair is wavy,damaged, and frizzy  - I've used this on my 3 yo daughters hair with the same results and her hair is spirly curls! I would say due to the differential in our hair types this is for use of all hair types!:)

Product: Pacifica Coconut milk detangle elixir, 7 Fl Oz
Title: It does the job without the chemicals
Review: I've been using Pacifica shampoo and conditioner for a few years and loved them. I purchased this product for two reasons:1. I needed something to keep the ends of my (long hair) pointy tail from knotting when I went out for a run2. The product needed to be free of harsh chemicals AND overbearing scents and artificial fragrances.This product was just perfect for my needs. It keeps the tangles at bay while providing just the right amount of moisture. There is a gentle coconut scent - nothing over-bearing. I recommend it highly!

Product: Pacifica Coconut milk detangle elixir, 7 Fl Oz
Title: Excellent detangler and leave in moisturizer
Review: I’ve been using this pacifica detangler for over a year now. I either order it from the actual site (as I am a big fan of the brand) or just here on Amazon when I want a single and fast transaction. I have long hair with a lot of dry, damaged ends from not having a hair cut since right before Covid, over a year and a half ago. I love the length I have obtained from this but I have to be sure to use plenty of conditioning things on my ends to prevent the ends from looking or becoming too frayed. With this product and others in my regimen I’d say that I’m pretty successful in keeping my hair looking and feeling healthy. Before Covid I was a regular trimmer (every few months), yet almost a year and a half later with no trims, I like my hair better than ever. This product is keeping my hair gorgeous and allowing me to continue to grow it out. Also, it smells good. It’s affordable. Go for it

Product: Pacifica Coconut milk detangle elixir, 7 Fl Oz
Title: It works!
Review: I was a bit worried this wouldn’t work because I have such fine/thin hair and I’m sensitive to certain scents/ingredients but I gave it a shot, and it does work and it’s got a nice coconut-y smell that isn’t too overwhelming, as long as I don’t use it in a closed off room. I also use it with a deranged brush, and both have saved my hair!

Product: Pacifica Coconut milk detangle elixir, 7 Fl Oz
Title: Conditions without weighing my fine hair down
Review: Great price and great detangle and leave-in conditioner. It helps whether I am doing my hair naturally curly or I style it. I have fine hair, and it doesn't weigh it down at all.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: The Holy Grail of shampoo for fine, greasy hair and scalp
Review: Folks, I've tried everything. Expensive shampoo. Cheap shampoo. No shampoo (no-poo). Natural shampoo. Essential oil rinses. Apple cider rinses.I have fine hair, and a lot of it. And it is always oily. We are talking: wash in the morning, dry shampoo along my hairline at the end of the day oily, and a hearty dry shampoo regimine if I'm going to try to go a day without washing.This shampoo has done what literraly no other shampoo has done - I can go three days without washing, and it still looks amazing. My hair is clean, soft, full of volume (an unexpected bonus, but I'll take it!) without using ANY product in it other than shampoo! And - I can let it air dry without it going incredibly flat! What???? How can this be true?!?!?!Welp, folks, it's real - a shampoo that actually helps your oily scalp, and provides you with volume, that you don't need to blow dry. This product has literally changed my whole hair routine!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Used
Review: This was a used, grimy bottle of shampoo that looks like it was refilled with a different product. There was no seal and shampoo was leaking around the edges.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: I like this invigorating shampoo
Review: I'm happy with the shampoo but wish the scent of rosemary was more noticeable. I still like the smell of the shampoo and the bottle does say 'rosemary and mint.' It's just that it smells more like mint than rosemary. I do like the way it leaves my hair after washing it because it is not tangled up like with other shampoos and it feels very moisturized and my scalp is definitely invigorated. I have not tried the companion conditioner yet and I think I may need to  buy one soon and try the combo. I definitely recommend it!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Another great Pacifica product
Review: Love this shampoo! My hair is long and thick, and has a tendency to be limp and a bit oily if wished in 'moisturizing' shampoos. But so many of them leave my hair feeling like straw. This shampoo does a great job of refreshing hair and scalp but not drying them out. The fragrance is so mild that it's a whiff instead of a smack in the nose! (Which for someone with allergies is great.) I've been using the Pacifica rosemary conditioner with another shampoo until that one ran out. Hurray! My hair's all Pacifica now.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Excellent for oily hair!
Review: Great for oily hair! I have tried SO MANY different shampoos and conditioners for my daughter, and this is by far the best! I have been using Pacifica for about ten years, and the quality is excellent. I only buy truly natural and chemical free cosmetics, and I love that I can count on them for great quality. This particular shampoo and conditioner combination is excellent! My daughter has oily hair, and even gets clogged pores in her scalp. I have tried more shampoo than I can count. This has been the best by far. Her hair is beautiful, and shiny, and is not heavy. It washes out easily for her, which is another struggle for her. It gives her a nice clean wash, without drying out her hair.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Better than salon conditioner
Review: This leaves your hair soft and smooth yet easily manageable. It's perfect when using it after the matching shampoo.  Just be sure to rinse until the slick feeling is gone so that it leaves bounce and doesn't weigh your hair down.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Will buy again!
Review: I’m a Pacifica enthusiast and this has been added to my list of favorites! The smell is amazing. As a detox shampoo, this does make your hair feel a bit “stripped” at first , so I am always sure to give my hair a little extra TLC while conditioning afterwards. Overall a great product.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Great Shampoo
Review: I started out not really liking this shampoo and conditioner.  It doesn't lather too well, so you have to use a lot.  It wasn't until I noticed that there was a lot less hair in my brush and drain that I started to notice the great affects it was having on my hair.  It feels fuller and I noticeably loose less hair.  I'd  highly recommend this shampoo to help with hair lose.  The smell is more peppermint than rosemary which I'd have liked more rosemary scent.  Try it!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: This shampoo is great, but with a small scent and tingly feel on my scalp
Review: I like this shampoo because it's vegan, cruelty free, and doesn't have any harmful preservatives or SLS. It does a great job washing my hair, and it has a slight scent to it which smells pretty good. However, I should warn you that the product will give you scalp a tingly feeling to it, I think it's the mint in the product that gives you that feeling. So if you don't want to have that feeling on your scalp then don't get this shampoo. I don't mind it though, the mint is supposed to help soothe your scalp if you have dandruff or eczema like me.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is less a clarifying shampoo than a stripping shampoo and if you are purchasing it in the hope of using it as a less expensive replacement for the tried and true standard bearer of the rosemary mint genre, you will be deeply unsatisfied with the outcome.I wanted to love this. It has a wonderful light minty scent that is precisely enough without being too much, and the shampoo itself is a great consistency. The performance, however, leaves much to be desired, and it basically feels like I’ve washed my hair with a bar of cheap soap (not exaggerating, that’s very analogous to the result).Put simply: After using this stuff, I literally had to *rewash* my hair with my large bottle of (very cheap/not so great) all in one shampoo/conditioner I only keep around for emergencies.Perhaps your luck will be better than mine. It does, again, smell wonderful.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: A must have
Review: I recommend getting the Pacifica scalp detox scrub and follow up with this shampoo for the best possible results. It leaves my scalp feeling so refreshed and clean. It also helps control oil buildup so if you have to skip a day of washing your hair your hair still looks clean and freshly washed the next day.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Sleek
Review: Don't need a lot! I have very thick hair but using only a nickle sized amount covers my whole head. I only wash my hair once a week so I need about 4 washes to see a big change. I had bad dandruff from working in a dry environment. Never had dandruff before then. Anyway, this helped A TON. My hair feels so sleek and commercial-like.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Great Scent
Review: I love the smell and feel of the product. Anything by this brand I normally love.A word of warning to those with sensitive skin, this one really irritated my skin. I get eczema easily so this is not something I could keep on using.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Love it so far
Review: Both the shampoo and conditioner are new to me. I was looking for something to really cleanse my scalp while being gentle and kind to my home-dyed hair.  I like the way they smell.  I've only used them once but so far so good.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Same price & quality as purchased in store
Review: It is exactly the same as when purchased in store. Very handy to have delivered when I can't get to the big box store that sells it. I'm very picky about scent & really love this stuff.

It can make your eyes water tho 😂 it definitely gives you that invigorating clean. It washes away all the impurities that other shampoos and conditioners have deposited on your hair. Take care of yourself with this brand! I will never NOT recommend this brand to everyone I talk to.

Title: Awesome for oily hair!
Review: My hair is notoriously oily at the roots. Most other shampoos (like tea tree oil shampoos) tend to make my hair feel "stripped" if that makes any sense, and don't necessarily help with oily roots. Well, this is 3 days after my last shampoo! Would normally look like an oil slick, but no longer. So glad I made this impulse buy. Also, I agree with other reviewers that the smell is more minty than rosemary, but not necessarily in a bad way.

Title: Smells great!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Great smell

Title: Not what I thought would be, too drying.
Review: This was more drying than moisturizing. Same with the shampoo.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Underwhelming
Review: I like the ingredient list, no sulfates or pthalates, but overall I am not impressed. The shampoo has a strange consistency, and both smell like herbal peppermint. It’s not bad, but definitely not very good. I’ve noticed less buildup on my scalp (yay!) and no real change in hair growth or loss (oh well), but my hair definitely isn’t as clean and does NOT stay clean as long as cheaper shampoos. (Maybe it’s the price to pay for being sulfate free but it is still disappointing.) I am not sure what if anything the conditioner does, and don’t plan on buying either again.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Why I subscribe
Review: This shampoo is the reason I started the subscription service through Amazon. I now get all my household stuff delivered monthly BUT this shampoo is the ONLY shampoo that helped my daughters dry scalp. It started this fall and got significantly worse in the winter. No one in my family had flakes like hers. We tried everything and of course head and shoulders actually made it worse. This is one of many I bought at target to try and it was the winner by a land slide. target doesn’t consistently have this in stock and it’s the exact same price as here so I now have it delivered every 3 weeks. Best best best dry scalp shampoo with a great scent.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Rosemary Purify Invigorating Shampoo + Rosemary Purify Invigorating Conditioner | Detox Scalp and Hair from Product Buildup & Excess Oil | 100% Vegan & Cruelty | Sulfate + Paraben Free
Title: Nice and minty
Review: Wanted to like this more but the shampoo is very drying but once you follow with conditioner hair is soft and manageable.I massaged both in my scalp and it was refreshing.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: The Holy Grail of shampoo for fine, greasy hair and scalp
Review: Folks, I've tried everything. Expensive shampoo. Cheap shampoo. No shampoo (no-poo). Natural shampoo. Essential oil rinses. Apple cider rinses.I have fine hair, and a lot of it. And it is always oily. We are talking: wash in the morning, dry shampoo along my hairline at the end of the day oily, and a hearty dry shampoo regimine if I'm going to try to go a day without washing.This shampoo has done what literraly no other shampoo has done - I can go three days without washing, and it still looks amazing. My hair is clean, soft, full of volume (an unexpected bonus, but I'll take it!) without using ANY product in it other than shampoo! And - I can let it air dry without it going incredibly flat! What???? How can this be true?!?!?!Welp, folks, it's real - a shampoo that actually helps your oily scalp, and provides you with volume, that you don't need to blow dry. This product has literally changed my whole hair routine!

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Used
Review: This was a used, grimy bottle of shampoo that looks like it was refilled with a different product. There was no seal and shampoo was leaking around the edges.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: I like this invigorating shampoo
Review: I'm happy with the shampoo but wish the scent of rosemary was more noticeable. I still like the smell of the shampoo and the bottle does say 'rosemary and mint.' It's just that it smells more like mint than rosemary. I do like the way it leaves my hair after washing it because it is not tangled up like with other shampoos and it feels very moisturized and my scalp is definitely invigorated. I have not tried the companion conditioner yet and I think I may need to  buy one soon and try the combo. I definitely recommend it!

Title: Another great Pacifica product

This shampoo does a great job of refreshing hair and scalp but not drying them out. The fragrance is so mild that it's a whiff instead of a smack in the nose! (Which for someone with allergies is great.) I've been using the Pacifica rosemary conditioner with another shampoo until that one ran out. Hurray! My hair's all Pacifica now.

I have been using Pacifica for about ten years, and the quality is excellent. I only buy truly natural and chemical free cosmetics, and I love that I can count on them for great quality. This particular shampoo and conditioner combination is excellent! My daughter has oily hair, and even gets clogged pores in her scalp. I have tried more shampoo than I can count. Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Will buy again!
Review: I’m a Pacifica enthusiast and this has been added to my list of favorites! The smell is amazing. As a detox shampoo, this does make your hair feel a bit “stripped” at first , so I am always sure to give my hair a little extra TLC while conditioning afterwards. Overall a great product.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Great Shampoo
Review: I started out not really liking this shampoo and conditioner.  It doesn't lather too well, so you have to use a lot.  It wasn't until I noticed that there was a lot less hair in my brush and drain that I started to notice the great affects it was having on my hair.  It feels fuller and I noticeably loose less hair.  I'd  highly recommend this shampoo to help with hair lose.  The smell is more peppermint than rosemary which I'd have liked more rosemary scent.  Try it!

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: This shampoo is great, but with a small scent and tingly feel on my scalp
Review: I like this shampoo because it's vegan, cruelty free, and doesn't have any harmful preservatives or SLS. It does a great job washing my hair, and it has a slight scent to it which smells pretty good. However, I should warn you that the product will give you scalp a tingly feeling to it, I think it's the mint in the product that gives you that feeling. So if you don't want to have that feeling on your scalp then don't get this shampoo. I don't mind it though, the mint is supposed to help soothe your scalp if you have dandruff or eczema like me.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is less a clarifying shampoo than a stripping shampoo and if you are purchasing it in the hope of using it as a less expensive replacement for the tried and true standard bearer of the rosemary mint genre, you will be deeply unsatisfied with the outcome.I wanted to love this. It has a wonderful light minty scent that is precisely enough without being too much, and the shampoo itself is a great consistency. The performance, however, leaves much to be desired, and it basically feels like I’ve washed my hair with a bar of cheap soap (not exaggerating, that’s very analogous to the result).Put simply: After using this stuff, I literally had to *rewash* my hair with my large bottle of (very cheap/not so great) all in one shampoo/conditioner I only keep around for emergencies.Perhaps your luck will be better than mine. It does, again, smell wonderful.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: A must have
Review: I recommend getting the Pacifica scalp detox scrub and follow up with this shampoo for the best possible results. It leaves my scalp feeling so refreshed and clean. It also helps control oil buildup so if you have to skip a day of washing your hair your hair still looks clean and freshly washed the next day.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Sleek
Review: Don't need a lot! I have very thick hair but using only a nickle sized amount covers my whole head. I only wash my hair once a week so I need about 4 washes to see a big change. I had bad dandruff from working in a dry environment. Never had dandruff before then. Anyway, this helped A TON. My hair feels so sleek and commercial-like.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Great Scent
Review: I love the smell and feel of the product. Anything by this brand I normally love.A word of warning to those with sensitive skin, this one really irritated my skin. I get eczema easily so this is not something I could keep on using.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Love it so far
Review: Both the shampoo and conditioner are new to me. I was looking for something to really cleanse my scalp while being gentle and kind to my home-dyed hair.  I like the way they smell.  I've only used them once but so far so good.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Same price & quality as purchased in store
Review: It is exactly the same as when purchased in store. Very handy to have delivered when I can't get to the big box store that sells it. I'm very picky about scent & really love this stuff.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Leaves you feeling super clean!
Review: The scent is very strong, but if you don’t mind the way tea tree oil smells or rosemary then it won’t bother you! It can make your eyes water tho 😂 it definitely gives you that invigorating clean. It washes away all the impurities that other shampoos and conditioners have deposited on your hair. Take care of yourself with this brand! I will never NOT recommend this brand to everyone I talk to.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Good shampoo
Review: Although would prefer scent free for every day breathing and skin health as well...its fragrance is a nice light herb smell that is not migraine or sneeze inducing!

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Leaked in package
Review: I haven't used it yet but it did leak and get over all of the other items I'd ordered. Luckily almost everything I ordered with it was individually wrapped but it did leak out of the plastic that it was in. I don't want to have to send it back so I'll still use it and try to remember to update afterwards. I do like the smell.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Deserves all the5 star reviews!
Review: Rosemary Purify may be the best variety of shampoo that Pacifica makes. Really got my hair and scalp feeling clean, without stripping  color, etc. Great fresh fragrance too.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Love it
Review: This has definitely made my hair less oily and I can go 2 days between washes instead of just 1. It smells great, lathers well and rinses clean.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Great product
Review: Love the shampoo but wasn't impressed with the conditioner I felt like it took the moisture out of my hair smells nice not to over powering

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Amazing!
Review: Love this! I have always struggled with dandruff and this is the first shampoo that cleared it up! I love the scent and tingly feeling. This is the shampoo i will keep buying from now on

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Awesome for oily hair!
Review: My hair is notoriously oily at the roots. Most other shampoos (like tea tree oil shampoos) tend to make my hair feel "stripped" if that makes any sense, and don't necessarily help with oily roots. Well, this is 3 days after my last shampoo! Would normally look like an oil slick, but no longer. So glad I made this impulse buy. Also, I agree with other reviewers that the smell is more minty than rosemary, but not necessarily in a bad way.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Cleaned my hair well

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Smells great!
Review: Smells great, makes my hair look good, and is vegan and cruelty free.  This is my new go to every time I buy new conditioner (and the matching shampoo).

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Great smell
Review: I love the minty smell of this shampoo.  I also love that it's vegan and cruelty free.  It makes my scalp feel really clean too.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Not what I thought would be, too drying.
Review: This was more drying than moisturizing. Same with the shampoo.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Underwhelming
Review: I like the ingredient list, no sulfates or pthalates, but overall I am not impressed. The shampoo has a strange consistency, and both smell like herbal peppermint. It’s not bad, but definitely not very good. I’ve noticed less buildup on my scalp (yay!) and no real change in hair growth or loss (oh well), but my hair definitely isn’t as clean and does NOT stay clean as long as cheaper shampoos. (Maybe it’s the price to pay for being sulfate free but it is still disappointing.) I am not sure what if anything the conditioner does, and don’t plan on buying either again.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Why I subscribe
Review: This shampoo is the reason I started the subscription service through Amazon. I now get all my household stuff delivered monthly BUT this shampoo is the ONLY shampoo that helped my daughters dry scalp. It started this fall and got significantly worse in the winter. No one in my family had flakes like hers. We tried everything and of course head and shoulders actually made it worse. This is one of many I bought at target to try and it was the winner by a land slide. target doesn’t consistently have this in stock and it’s the exact same price as here so I now have it delivered every 3 weeks. Best best best dry scalp shampoo with a great scent.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Shampoo - Rosemary Purify 12 oz
Title: Nice and minty
Review: Wanted to like this more but the shampoo is very drying but once you follow with conditioner hair is soft and manageable.I massaged both in my scalp and it was refreshing.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Conditioner - Rosemary Purify 8 oz
Title: The Holy Grail of shampoo for fine, greasy hair and scalp
Review: Folks, I've tried everything. Expensive shampoo. Cheap shampoo. No shampoo (no-poo). Natural shampoo. Essential oil rinses. Apple cider rinses.I have fine hair, and a lot of it. And it is always oily. We are talking: wash in the morning, dry shampoo along my hairline at the end of the day oily, and a hearty dry shampoo regimine if I'm going to try to go a day without washing.This shampoo has done what literraly no other shampoo has done - I can go three days without washing, and it still looks amazing. My hair is clean, soft, full of volume (an unexpected bonus, but I'll take it!) without using ANY product in it other than shampoo! And - I can let it air dry without it going incredibly flat! What???? How can this be true?!?!?!Welp, folks, it's real - a shampoo that actually helps your oily scalp, and provides you with volume, that you don't need to blow dry. This product has literally changed my whole hair routine!

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Conditioner - Rosemary Purify 8 oz
Title: Used
Review: This was a used, grimy bottle of shampoo that looks like it was refilled with a different product. There was no seal and shampoo was leaking around the edges.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Conditioner - Rosemary Purify 8 oz
Title: I like this invigorating shampoo
Review: I'm happy with the shampoo but wish the scent of rosemary was more noticeable. I still like the smell of the shampoo and the bottle does say 'rosemary and mint.' It's just that it smells more like mint than rosemary. I do like the way it leaves my hair after washing it because it is not tangled up like with other shampoos and it feels very moisturized and my scalp is definitely invigorated. I have not tried the companion conditioner yet and I think I may need to  buy one soon and try the combo. I definitely recommend it!

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Conditioner - Rosemary Purify 8 oz
Title: Another great Pacifica product
Review: Love this shampoo! My hair is long and thick, and has a tendency to be limp and a bit oily if wished in 'moisturizing' shampoos. But so many of them leave my hair feeling like straw. This shampoo does a great job of refreshing hair and scalp but not drying them out. The fragrance is so mild that it's a whiff instead of a smack in the nose! (Which for someone with allergies is great.) I've been using the Pacifica rosemary conditioner with another shampoo until that one ran out. Hurray! My hair's all Pacifica now.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Conditioner - Rosemary Purify 8 oz
Title: Excellent for oily hair!
Review: Great for oily hair! I have tried SO MANY different shampoos and conditioners for my daughter, and this is by far the best! I have been using Pacifica for about ten years, and the quality is excellent. I only buy truly natural and chemical free cosmetics, and I love that I can count on them for great quality. This particular shampoo and conditioner combination is excellent! My daughter has oily hair, and even gets clogged pores in her scalp. I have tried more shampoo than I can count. This has been the best by far. Her hair is beautiful, and shiny, and is not heavy. It washes out easily for her, which is another struggle for her. It gives her a nice clean wash, without drying out her hair.

Product: Pacifica Invigorating Conditioner - Rosemary Purify 8 oz
Title: Better than salon conditioner
Review: This leaves your hair soft and smooth yet easily manageable. It's perfect when using it after the matching shampoo.  Just be sure to rinse until the slick feeling is gone so that it leaves bounce and doesn't weigh your hair down.

Product: Pacifica Beauty | Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum + Rosemary Detox Scalp Scrub | Gently Exfoliates and Remove Product Buildup | Purify and Revive Your Scalp | 100% Vegan and Cruelty Free
Title: It's water... underwhelming.
Review: I was highly anticipating this as a close friend of mine loves Pacifica's products (she hasn't tried this one in particular.) I'm not one to usually go after the latest "snake oil", my intentions were really just to have that advertised good smell and maybe feel like my scalp was fresher afterwards. I'm SO disappointed. It's... water. Yes, it's a little slick, there are oils etc in it. It has an herbal smell of some kind (not one I recognize as Rosemary Mint) but only if I practically have my nose in the bottle. I tried this before shampooing as instructed and honestly my hair just felt gross and I couldn't smell or feel anything while massaging into my scalp. I will say the saving grace was that the return process was a breeze. They offered me returnless refund via Amazon credit, which I'm fine with.If Pacifica works for you, great. Maybe this was a weak/bad batch, I don't know. But I will say I had a better smelling and more cleansing experience using my husband's $2 Rosemary Mint Suave shampoo.

Product: Pacifica Beauty | Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum + Rosemary Detox Scalp Scrub | Gently Exfoliates and Remove Product Buildup | Purify and Revive Your Scalp | 100% Vegan and Cruelty Free
Title: I like it
Review: This is my first scalp serum. I have very itchy and oily scalp and hoped to find a product that would soothe. I wouldn't say this has a cooling effect, but it makes my roots feel nourished and decreases some build-up. I like to massage one full dropper of serum into my scalp after washing my hair. It leaves absolutely no stickiness or residue.

Product: Pacifica Beauty | Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum + Rosemary Detox Scalp Scrub | Gently Exfoliates and Remove Product Buildup | Purify and Revive Your Scalp | 100% Vegan and Cruelty Free
Title: Perky hair overnight
Review: Not sure about the negative reviews.  This product is great!  My hair is perky at the roots and for someone (me) with super fine hair and thingning it makes a huge difference.  I usually do an overnight treatment and today trying an after shower leave in treatment.  Definitely recommend this but you have figure out what works for you as far as treatment.

Product: Pacifica Beauty | Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum + Rosemary Detox Scalp Scrub | Gently Exfoliates and Remove Product Buildup | Purify and Revive Your Scalp | 100% Vegan and Cruelty Free
Title: Relief for itchy scalp. Great for wig wearers!
Review: I was experiencing itching in the area I wear my wig grip band, and it was driving me up the wall. This product provided relief from a dry irritated scalp. However, I had to use it more frequently than directed.  After a few days of applications and hair washings the itchiness went away.

Title: Pacifica produces another GEM!
Review: This is a hidden gem product. I love Pacifica, but I haven't tried everything they offer. This stuff made an immediate impact on my hair, which is vibrantly colored. It smells fresh and delicious. It's softening, soothing, and refreshing. It just plain works, so don't hesitate to give it a try. As far as I know, you can return it if you don't like it, but I'm hoping you will love it as much as I do.

Title: Not worth the money.

I ended up stepping on more of the product in the shower than what actually ended up on my scalp.

Title: Too chunky

Title: This contains small rocks.

Title: Has my scalp free of ingrown hairs
Review: After years of painful ingrown hairs on back of my scalp, my Barber recommended this due to her personal experience. I bought it doubting my lifelong problem would be fixed. One use and my scalp looked and felt COMPLETELY different within two weeks. Now, me, my barber as well as the shop owner recommend this to everyone they meet who has ingrown hairs on their scalp. It’s better than any of the other 5 products I own.

Product: Pacifica Beauty | Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum + Rosemary Detox Scalp Scrub | Gently Exfoliates and Remove Product Buildup | Purify and Revive Your Scalp | 100% Vegan and Cruelty Free
Title: Easy to use & helped my dry, itchy scalp.
Review: I have been using this a few nights a week for about a month as an overnight scalp treatment. It has a thin, viscous texture. The texture and ingredients are fairly similar to a basic facial serum (hyaluronic acid, b5,aloe, witch hazel). I apply 4 droppers full in lines over my scalp from front to back, then massage it gently into the scalp and comb the residue through my roots before bed. In the am I shower as usual. This winter had been pretty hard on my skin in general with me needing extra thick moisturizers on my full arms and legs as opposed to just my knees and elbows. This has really helped with my dry, itchy scalp. I don't think this serum would work for a scalp condition like dandruff that needs medication; but for just a dry scalp it really made a difference. I took a star off for the poor dropper. It seems to have trouble pulling the product from the container.

Product: Pacifica Beauty | Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum + Rosemary Detox Scalp Scrub | Gently Exfoliates and Remove Product Buildup | Purify and Revive Your Scalp | 100% Vegan and Cruelty Free
Title: PAIN to use!!
Review: This stuff is a PAIN to use! It is HARD to get down into the roots and the salt grains are HUGE, they just roll off of your head! If the salt crystals were 1/4 the size, it would be much easier to use. It smells great, but the poor instructions on the tube dont explain how to use it to get the most benefit.

Title: Perfect Pacifica Addition

Title: Not Impressed

It smells like tea tree oil but a little lighter so that wasn't bad. It is not an easy product to work with overall. I wouldn't recommend.

Product: Pacifica Beauty | Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum + Rosemary Detox Scalp Scrub | Gently Exfoliates and Remove Product Buildup | Purify and Revive Your Scalp | 100% Vegan and Cruelty Free
Title: Tricky to use but helpful
Review: My scalp is incredibly sensitive. I have tried a lot of products over the years to get it to calm down, from prescription Nizoral to tea tree oil to tar shampoo and apple cider vinegar, but it's only cleared up temporarily at best. I saw this and decided to give it a try. The comments about the chunks of salt are on point; the scrub could be pulverized into a much finer paste, and bits of salt literally clinked in the sink when they fell off my scalp. I also found it 100% impossible to use with dry hair - I had to wet my hair so I could part it enough to apply the scrub. Having said that, once I got it in my hair and on my scalp, I was able to scrub it into a bit of a lather (maybe because of the jojoba oil?) and work it into the skin. The effect has been SO satisfying! My scalp is actually clear - free of irritated patches and dandruff - and my hair feels great! I did not shampoo at all, just used a heavy duty conditioner afterward, as the scrub made the hair feel quite dry at first. I am picking little dots of charcoal out of my hair here and there, but that's a small price to pay for not having an oozing, itchy scalp.For future use, I'm going to get some kind of a squirt bottle (like they use for hair dye), add a little warm water to dissolve the larger salt particles, and use it with wet hair. I may coat the length of my hair with coconut oil and let the whole thing sit for awhile, like a deep conditioning treatment. Overall, I wouldn't use this product if you don't have a problem with dandruff/scalp conditions, because of the way the product is formatted, but it is truly useful if you have issues with your scalp.

Product: Pacifica Beauty | Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum + Rosemary Detox Scalp Scrub | Gently Exfoliates and Remove Product Buildup | Purify and Revive Your Scalp | 100% Vegan and Cruelty Free
Title: How is rock salt good for your hair?
Review: The chunks of salt in this could be put in a salt grinder they are so big!  This would not feel good on any part of your body. let alone on your scalp, it seems like it would be more damaging to your hair by breaking it. And cutting it.

Product: Pacifica Beauty | Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum + Rosemary Detox Scalp Scrub | Gently Exfoliates and Remove Product Buildup | Purify and Revive Your Scalp | 100% Vegan and Cruelty Free
Title: Instant Relief
Review: I have the most incredible itch on my scalp, particulary the back of my head. I'm still trying to figure out if the cause is from the detergent i use on my pillow case, the soap i use, or some sort of infection... I use various oils and lotions for my scalp to relieve the itch, but i know that these things can build up over time, and its best to backtrack on the first product to reach my head, which would be the shampoo. In conjunction to this product, i've tried an apple cider vinegar wash, which made no difference to the severe itch i was having. On that day when i used apple cider vinegar, I had to go back in the shower to wash with the Pacifica scrub, and the minute it touch my scalp, i had instant relif! I sighed as if i was having the best massage. I couldnt believe how immediate i received results. I've used it for two weeks so far, and i'm happy to be relatively itch fee (i occassionally get itchy scalp from laying on my pillow or if i wash my hair with hot water, but i never get itchy if i wash with cooler water and use this product.I'm sad that other customers are having trouble with the large grains of salt. I have slightly textured hair that is very fine, very very dry, and is sparce (my hair follicles are very spaced out, i have excruciatingly thin hair and not at all attractive). So i dont have trouble rinsing out the grains, although i do take a bit longer than normal to fully rinse out everything. Using my nails help with removing the chunks.I do recommend this product and i plan on making this my go-to itch reliever.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: It's water... underwhelming.
Review: I was highly anticipating this as a close friend of mine loves Pacifica's products (she hasn't tried this one in particular.) I'm not one to usually go after the latest "snake oil", my intentions were really just to have that advertised good smell and maybe feel like my scalp was fresher afterwards. I'm SO disappointed. It's... water. Yes, it's a little slick, there are oils etc in it. It has an herbal smell of some kind (not one I recognize as Rosemary Mint) but only if I practically have my nose in the bottle. I tried this before shampooing as instructed and honestly my hair just felt gross and I couldn't smell or feel anything while massaging into my scalp. I will say the saving grace was that the return process was a breeze. They offered me returnless refund via Amazon credit, which I'm fine with.If Pacifica works for you, great. Maybe this was a weak/bad batch, I don't know. But I will say I had a better smelling and more cleansing experience using my husband's $2 Rosemary Mint Suave shampoo.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: I like it
Review: This is my first scalp serum. I have very itchy and oily scalp and hoped to find a product that would soothe. I wouldn't say this has a cooling effect, but it makes my roots feel nourished and decreases some build-up. I like to massage one full dropper of serum into my scalp after washing my hair. It leaves absolutely no stickiness or residue.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Perky hair overnight
Review: Not sure about the negative reviews.  This product is great!  My hair is perky at the roots and for someone (me) with super fine hair and thingning it makes a huge difference.  I usually do an overnight treatment and today trying an after shower leave in treatment.  Definitely recommend this but you have figure out what works for you as far as treatment.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Relief for itchy scalp. Great for wig wearers!
Review: I was experiencing itching in the area I wear my wig grip band, and it was driving me up the wall. This product provided relief from a dry irritated scalp. However, I had to use it more frequently than directed.  After a few days of applications and hair washings the itchiness went away.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Pacifica produces another GEM!
Review: This is a hidden gem product. I love Pacifica, but I haven't tried everything they offer. This stuff made an immediate impact on my hair, which is vibrantly colored. It smells fresh and delicious. It's softening, soothing, and refreshing. It just plain works, so don't hesitate to give it a try. As far as I know, you can return it if you don't like it, but I'm hoping you will love it as much as I do.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz

Review: This scrub has huge pieces of sea salt in the formula but no matter how thoroughly I scrub I can’t feel them. I have short hair too. This product seemed to make my scalp more irritated than anything. The product was not a cohesive scrub it fell apart immediately when it got on my hands. I ended up stepping on more of the product in the shower than what actually ended up on my scalp.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Too chunky
Review: This smells really nice, but doesn't seem to do much scrubbing, as the particles are quite coarse and there aren't many of them to begin with. It seemed like 3 or 4 chunks of salt per square inch of scalp.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: This contains small rocks.
Review: This scalp scrub has rocks in it.  I have thick hair and it was hard to wash all the rocks out of my hair.  I had my hair up at work. My scalp was itchy and sore. I had a small rock still stuck in my hair near my scalp.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Has my scalp free of ingrown hairs
Review: After years of painful ingrown hairs on back of my scalp, my Barber recommended this due to her personal experience. I bought it doubting my lifelong problem would be fixed. One use and my scalp looked and felt COMPLETELY different within two weeks. Now, me, my barber as well as the shop owner recommend this to everyone they meet who has ingrown hairs on their scalp. It’s better than any of the other 5 products I own.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Easy to use & helped my dry, itchy scalp.
Review: I have been using this a few nights a week for about a month as an overnight scalp treatment. It has a thin, viscous texture. The texture and ingredients are fairly similar to a basic facial serum (hyaluronic acid, b5,aloe, witch hazel). I apply 4 droppers full in lines over my scalp from front to back, then massage it gently into the scalp and comb the residue through my roots before bed. In the am I shower as usual. This winter had been pretty hard on my skin in general with me needing extra thick moisturizers on my full arms and legs as opposed to just my knees and elbows. This has really helped with my dry, itchy scalp. I don't think this serum would work for a scalp condition like dandruff that needs medication; but for just a dry scalp it really made a difference. I took a star off for the poor dropper. It seems to have trouble pulling the product from the container.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: PAIN to use!!
Review: This stuff is a PAIN to use! It is HARD to get down into the roots and the salt grains are HUGE, they just roll off of your head! If the salt crystals were 1/4 the size, it would be much easier to use. It smells great, but the poor instructions on the tube dont explain how to use it to get the most benefit.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Perfect Pacifica Addition
Review: I’ve been looking for a product to clear my crown chakra and this does the trick with sage. It soothes and hydrates the scalp just like a spa treatment. Simply massage into scalp then shampoo out or leave in overnight.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Not Impressed
Review: Like many others were saying this product isn't right. I was surprised the beads weren't water dissolvable. So you get it in your hair and it is a pain to get out. AVOID if you have thick or a lot of hair. My hair is short and all the way thru shampooing and conditioning I was still picking out those little beads. It smells like tea tree oil but a little lighter so that wasn't bad. It is not an easy product to work with overall. I wouldn't recommend.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Meh

I made sure to follow instructions with sectioning my hair but it still just ended up in my hair & not my scalp. I used the whole bottle to try & give it a fair shot but it’s not worth repurchasing. Plus it runs out too fast.The only reason for the 2 star was the smell & “minty” feeling it gives my hair.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: It smells great! Wish it worked better

It smelled great and loved the way it felt on my scalp. Not sure it made much a differece on my scalp even after using as an overnight treatment.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Pacifica
Review: I really enjoyed using this. It has a very light scent and is really great when using to massage the scalp. I know it says only to use 3 to 4 drops but it requires a few more than that be able to distribute throughout your scalp. Other than that it is marvelous.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Great for scalp, works for me.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Witch hazel is not for the scalp.

I also did some research on whether or not if you should use witch hazel on your scalp and it specifically said online not to. All because there is a potential risk of irritation, especially if you have sensitive skin.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Great for Dry Scalps
Review: I’ve always had an incredibly dry scalp and with this stuff, it’s been really amazing.I greatly changed my hair routine from washing every other day, to every 2-3 days. And the day before I use scalp serum, and then shower the next day.Using this, and clarifying conditioner and or shampoo SERIOUSLY helps with flakes!My scalp has literally never been so moisturized.Highly recommend. Will keep buying this great product!

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Didn't work for me.
Review: I got this to help with psoriasis like patches I get on my scalp. The contents are very think with exfoliating beads. I have long think hair and it was difficult for me to get the scrub to where I wanted it on my head while moving my hair around. I really could only exfoliate the edges of my scalp. It almost felt like I needed to do it outside of the shower and section off my hair. Not a fan.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz

Review: This wasn't a horrible scalp scrub but if you have medium to thick hair it is very difficult to get it to rinse completely out.  My scalp felt itchy after and I kept finding seed type things (I think that this was a part of the exfoliant). The smell wasn't bad but not rinsing clean is definitely a deal breaker for me.

Product: Pacifica Beauty Scalp Love Rosemary Mint Serum Purifies Revives Scalp Vegan CrueltyFree, Clear, 2 Fl Oz
Title: Not greasy
Review: I really like this scalp oil it does it’s job in moisturizing the scalp and doesn’t look greasy it’s a very fine oil.
